loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 37-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. He describes himself to be God fearing. 

Wycliffe operates a retail store where he sells shoes, school bags, etc. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a potential area and his primary customers are commercial, schools and institutions. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. 

Wycliffe will use the KES 55,500 loan to buy a solar panel, cables, a battery and a television.This will enable him to light his house with solar energy. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. 

Wycliffe hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel, cables, a solar battery and a television.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio  está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Pablina es una de las integrantes, ella es una persona que se gana la vida con la venta de comestibles, y cuenta que se ha hecho de una clientela  ya que sus comestibles son muy aceptados por sus clientes. Ella es una persona con mucha habilidad y que quiere seguir luchando para mejorar.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y demás, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar.
texts.en: The San Antonio group is in its 6th cycle of the women's communal bank programme.  The group's members live in Concepción, which is a growing city, a little way from the central zone.  It is a hard-to-reach area and the group members, therefore, want to strive to grow steadily and give the area where they live a better environment.  Pablina, one of the group's members, earns her living by selling groceries and says that she has built up a good clientele as her groceries are appreciated by her customers.  She is a very able person who wants to continue striving to improve.  She is applying for this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies (meat, vegetables, condiments and other things) so she can continue selling her groceries.  This will mean that she can continue working and striving to improve.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other things

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 54-year-old married woman doing a business of selling milk for many years. She has four cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and ghee that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

She has five children and one of them is school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of her life. 

Khursheed has now requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase one more cow to increase her business. It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through support of it. She hopes to get increase in the production of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is from Gyumri town in Armenia. She lives with her mother, brother, and 3-year-old daughter. 

She opened a small cafe in Gyumri town two years ago. Due to her hard work over these two years, Lusine was able to gain a good client base. She provides high-quality service and tasty dishes, and that's why her cafe is in demand among locals. 

Now Lusine needs financial support for purchasing a TV for her cafe. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Lusine is very grateful to all her lenders for their support. The loan is very important for Lusine to be able to provide better conditions for her clients.

loans.use: to pay for a TV for her cafe

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married with two children, one underage and the other in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three months, she has operated a business of selling colorful "leso" (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 30 pieces of leso cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pieces of colorful "leso" cloth (women's wrap) for resale.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with eleven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Dama has operated a business of selling khangas (women wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the KES 20,000, Dama wants to purchase 40 pieces of khangas cloths for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of khangas (women wrap) cloths for resale.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and his three children in Nablus. He has been selling sheep since 2012. Adnan works hard to support his family and to provide good living conditions for his children.

Adnan is asking Ryada for this loan to purchase livestock. This will increase the size of his herd.

Adnan is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène est un femme de 27 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle possède un stand de vente de crédit de communication dans un quartier de la ville depuis 2 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des crédits de communication MTN et ORANGE afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses ventes.les profits générés vont être injectés dans son capital et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Hélène is a 27 year old single woman and the mother of one child. She owns a stand where she has sold communication credit in one of the city's neighborhoods for 2 years. She is asking for a loan to purchase MTN and ORANGE communication credits in order to satisfy her clients and increase her sales. The profits generated will be injected into her capital and will provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase communication credit

loans.name: Charol

texts.en:
Charol is a married woman and a mother of four children from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in the hog-raising business.
 
Charol is asking for a loan to buy animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business as well as her profit. 

Charol hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue which is necessary for the needs of her family especially for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 57-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of the Telavi district with his wife, son, and father. His father is provided with a retirement pension. George is involved in agriculture and grows maize on a 1.5 hectare plot of land. In addition, he has a vineyard and produces wine. George sells his harvested products to local retailers. 

George is requesting a 3,200 USD loan to purchase materials to build a greenhouse. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get his loan. George plans to grow mushrooms in his new greenhouse. His new business initiative will be a great support for his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married woman with one child who goes to school. For the past five years, she has operated a kiosk, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her greatest business challenge is price fluctuation. Mwanasha owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

Mwanasha is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to sell. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables and school fees.

For the past one year, Kanga has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Kanga wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen lives with his wife in Yerevan town. He has been earning his living by providing installation services to locals for over 15 years. Armen installs air conditioning and heating systems by receiving orders. Now, in order to purchase tools and equipment needed for his work, Armen applied for this loan. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Armen to continue his business and provide better quality work to locals.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment needed for providing installation services.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 20 years old and single. He lives with his parents. Mustafa works hard to provide his family’s income.

Mustafa is a student in ninth grade and owns a small shop where he sells mobile phones and their accessories. He established his business in 2012 and has gained good experience in this field. Mustafa is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation since he not only sells mobile phones but also provides maintenance services for his customers.

Every year, Mustafa faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the school year for the additional expenses of school fees, a uniform, and books. He is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition fees and other school expenses. With this loan, now he can accommodate all these expenses. 

The story of Mustafa is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona For Economic Development clients that are able to get a better education.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is a broom maker from Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of a 14-year-old son. Dona has been making brooms for more than 14 years now. She works with her husband.

Dona is asking for a loan to buy materials for making brooms such as buri or native palm, dye, nails, bamboo sticks and rubber. With this, she will be able to make more brooms and sell them to the market. Dona hopes of expanding her business. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy materials for making brooms such as buri, dye, nails, bamboo sticks and rubber.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 29 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in Paynesville South. Her husband is a local businessman. Over the past three years, Laura has been selling red oil in the local market. She earns a profit and has many customers. 

Laura is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more red oil for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase red oil

loans.name: Muhsin

texts.en:
Muhsin is 39 years old and a farmer.  He is married and has six children. 

Muhsin has a beautiful child in the seventh grade named Zahra.  She is very smart and always get high grades.

He is requesting a loan to pay his daughter's tuition fees and other school expenses. Since Muhsin's source of income is seasonal, every year the family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of school for the additional expenses needed for school fees, uniforms, books. With this loan, now they can accommodate all these expenses.

The story of Muhsin and his daughter is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic-development clients that are able to get a better education.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Sandra Vanesa

texts.es: Sandra Vanesa, continúa con el empeño en el desarrollo de su propio negocio de venta de ropa, su esposo  ha apoyado directamente en la construcción de la casa porque es albañil, con esto se han ahorrado el pago de la mano de obra que es muy caro. Ambos están luchando en formar profesionalmente a su hija de 11 de años edad. Por medio del primer crédito que otorgó AFODENIC pudo repellar paredes y cambiar el techo de su casa, en esta ocasión ella pretende construir el frente de su casa, además de colocar piso de cerámica que ya posee, para lo cual necesita comprar materiales de construcción como: bloques, cemento, hierro, puertas y ventas.
texts.en:
Sandra Vanesa continues determinedly with the development of her own business selling clothes. Her husband directly supported the construction of the house because he is a brick layer. Because of this they have saved themselves the labour cost which is very expensive.

Both of them are working hard to professionally educate their 11-year-old daughter. 

Through the first loan that they received from AFODENIC, Sandra was able to whitewash the walls and change the roof of her house. This time she hopes to construct the front of their house, as well as lay a ceramic floor that she already has, for which she needs to buy construction materials like: blocks, cement, iron, doors and windows.

loans.use: To buy construction materials like: blocks, cement, iron, doors and windows.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is married and has three children who attend school. She operates a cafe, making items such as rice, tea, beans, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as a major challenge.


Mwanatumu is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase stock of goods such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for her business. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in society. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks

loans.name: Jarjay

texts.en:
Jarjay is 21 years old and is unmarried. Her boyfriend is a local businessman and they have a five-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. Jarjay lives in Paynesville South, a populous area of Montserrado County. For the past two years, she has been selling fire-coal in the local market and she makes lots of profit and has many customers.

Jarjay is requesting a loan to buy charcoal to sell. In the future, she plans to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more fire-coal to sell

loans.name: Yarmah

texts.en:
Yarmah is 31 years old and lives in Paynesville South with her boyfriend who is a local businessman. She has four children between 2 and 13 years old. Three of her children are currently in school and they all live at home. 

Yarmah was not lucky to have attended school but she manages to keep herself busy with her business for the past seven years now selling palm oil in the local market. She has a good profit every time she sells. 

Yarmah is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to build a house for her children and to educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Denise est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 11 et 13 ans, ils vont tous deux à l'école. Elle fait comme activité la sérigraphie depuis 2 ans déjà. Elle est très habille en dessin et peinture sérigraphie. La petitesse de son capital l'empêche souvent de faire des quantités importante pour revendre d'où l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle à cause des ruptures permanentes de ses stocks parce qu’elle est obligé d'acheter son matériel en détail. Elle aimerait pouvoir acheter des seaux de peintures et aussi un ordinateur pour améliorer la qualité de son travail et surtout les quantités à livrer. Elle veut réinvestir une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Denise is a young, married, 35-year-old woman who is the mother 2 children, who range in age from 11 to 13 years old and who are both in school. She has run a silkscreen painting business for 2 years. She is well-suited for silkscreen design and painting. The tininess of her supply of capital often prevents her from making the quantities needed for resale. Her clientele is dissatisfied because she is constantly running out of stock, as she is obliged to buy her materials at retail prices. She would like to be able to buy buckets of paints, as well as a computer in order to improve the quality of her work and especially the quantities for delivery. She wants to reinvest a part of her profits in her business and the rest will allow her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some buckets of paint.

loans.name: Faez

texts.en:
Faez is 34 years old and a farmer.  He is married and has five children. Faez has two beautiful children in school: Hanan, a girl in the first grade, and Ahmed, a boy in the third grade.  They are very smart and always get high grades.

Every day Fayz wakes up early to go to his farm and take care of his trees and his cattle to provide the family income.  But since his source of income is seasonal, every year the family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of school for the extra expenses needed to cover school fees,  uniform, books. 

Fayz is requesting a loan to pay for his children's tuition fees and other school expenses. With this loan, now they can accommodate all these expenses and keep the beautiful smiles on their faces.

The story of Faez and his children is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic-development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: to pay for his children’s education.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 32 years old and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Iganga in Uganda. For the past six years, Jalia has been working hard to manage her boutique where she sells clothes. 

Jalia is requesting a 2,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to increase her stock of new clothing to sell. Her loan will help to expand her business and generate greater profit which she will use to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Jalia hopes to expand her business. 

Jalia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jalia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en: Mlongo appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standard. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more mats for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more mats for resale.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is a married woman with three young children. For the past six years, she has earned a living through her sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various goods to people from her community. 

Mary Cris is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, sugar, beverages, and cooking ingredients. She will use her loan to diversify her stock and sell more products. In the future, Mary Cris hopes to expand her store and generate more revenue. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, sugar, beverages, and ingredients

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 33 years old and married. He has five children. He lives in the Marneuli district. The family lives below the poverty line and gets a small-sized social assistance from the local government. To generate income for his large family, Zaza hires a car and serves the locals as a taxi driver. He has been in this business for a month and he transports people from his district to the capital city. The project is profitable but the rent for the car is high so Zaza decided to purchase his own car. 

Zaza is requesting a loan for $2,000, which will enable him to continue his taxi business and earn a good income. He is a very experienced driver and a hardworking person with a great desire to ensure that his children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is 47 years old and married, the father of three children. He is a government employee.  

Sumaya is a student in the fifth grade who gets high grades in school. Because of Salim's low salary and no one else to help him provide the family income, every year he faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of school for the additional expenses needed to cover study fees and  books. 

Salim is requesting a loan to pay his daughter's school fees and other study expenses. With this loan, now he can accommodate all these expenses. 

Salim's dream is to be able to see all his children finish school and have the best education.

The story of Sumaya is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic-development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en:
Winrose is a 45-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be talkative. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, soap and other items. 

Winrose describes her family challenge to be lack of electricity and the high cost of fuel. She will use the KES 12,800 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting their house. 

Winrose hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to graduate level. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 30,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children who all go to school. She lives in the coastal region of Kenya. Mejumaa works selling makuti, which is thatching made from palm leaves. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mejumaa lives in her own house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mejumaa is requesting a loan to purchase more makuti to sell. She expects her loan to be without difficulty and hopes to continue working without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase makuti (palm leaf thatch) to sell

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Yerevan town where she lives with her daughter. She is a teacher with many years of experience who teaches at a local school. Gohar's daughter is a student at the Mehrabian Medical Institute. As Gohar is the only breadwinner in the family, it is very difficult for her to cover her family's daily needs and at the same time cover her daughter's education costs.  

Gohar is requesting a loan to pay her daughter’s university tuition. She will use her loan to give her daughter an opportunity to complete her education. Gohar hopes for good will from lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya. For the past year, she has operated a business of selling leso cloth which is used for women’s wraps. Mjeni’s major business challenge is seasonality. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mjeni is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase 40 pieces of leso to resell. In the future, she hopes to become a big clothing supplier.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of leso cloth to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who has three children between nine and 18. She is a farmer who grows crops to sell. Joyce describes herself as a go-getter. Her biggest business challenge is the lack of water to irrigate her crops. 

Joyce is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy a water pump to irrigate her crops. She hopes to improve her life in the future.

loans.use: buy a water pump to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Leidy Tatiana

texts.es: Leidy es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad que desea iniciar su propio negocio; motivada por la necesidad de generar recursos económicos para aportar a la economía de su familia y, en vista de que su inexperiencia en el ámbito laboral no le ha permitido encontrar oportunidades de empleo, ella está decidida a montar un almacén de venta de artículos de belleza en general. Esto la motiva a solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito con el que comprará unas vitrinas, estanterías y surtido de mercancía al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, cosméticos, esmaltes para uñas, tinturas, entre otros), con lo que podrá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Leidy sueña con fortalecer si negocio y convertirlo en una microempresa rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, que logre reconocimiento en el sector y, tener la posibilidad de generar oportunidades de empleo, pero, es consciente que para lograr sus objetivos debe trabajar de manera constante, disciplinada, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, esto es la clave para salir adelante y lograr una mejoría notable en la calidad de vida tanto de ella, como de otras personas.
texts.en:
Leidy is a young entrepreneur, age 21, who wants to start her own business.  Motivated by the need to generate economic resources to support her family, and because her inexperience in the labor market has not permitted her to find employment opportunities, she has decided to put together a shop selling beauty products.  This has led her to ask for her first loan, with which she will buy some display cabinets and shelving. She will also buy merchandise in bulk (hair treatments, shampoo, cosmetics, nail polish, and dyes, among others).  With these she will be able to get her project going and generate the income needed to support her home.

Leidy dreams of strengthening her business and transforming it into a profitable and sustainable microenterprise that is well known in the area and has the possibility of creating employment opportunities. However, she is aware that in order to achieve her objectives she should work steadily, with discipline, dedication, and a lot of effort.  This is the key to getting ahead and achieving a significant improvement in quality of life not only for her but for others as well.

loans.use: to buy some display cabinets and shelving, and to stock merchandise purchased wholesale (hair treatments, shampoo, cosmetics, nail polish, dyes, among others)

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik, a farmer from Gandzaqar village of Tavush region, lives with her husband, daughter and two school-age sons. To be able to take care of the family's needs, Shoghik is engaged in breeding pigs and hens and cultivating corn, beans, grass and some fruits (cherry, plum, quince, apple, pear, and walnut). Shoghik's husband takes the agricultural products to the local market

Farming is the only source of income for the family. To be able to meet the growing needs of her family more effectively, Shoghik wants to enlarge her livestock holdings. A loan of USD 1000 will assist her greatly, enabling her to purchase two pigs and some forage for the livestock. It will help the family sustain their agribusiness. 

Shoghik and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their help.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs and some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah lives in Paynesville South.  She is 29 years old and unmarried, with three children between 5 months and 10 years old; only two are currently in school, and they all live at home. 

For the past four years she has been selling palm oil, rice, vita, salt, etc., in the market. She started this business with a small amount received from her boyfriend.  Hannah says she enjoys the buying from her customers and the money she generates from her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, vita, salt, etc., for her business.  She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, vita, salt, etc., for her business

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school and one who is an adult. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Mbeyu has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

Mbeyu joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Geghecik

texts.en:
Geghetsik is an experienced agronomist from Gandzaqar village of Tavush region. Her family consists of her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two-year-old grandson. Geghetsik's son is currently a labor migrant in Russia; he works there and sends some money to the family, helping them cover their daily needs. 

Geghetsik is engaged in breeding cows, piglets, and hens and cultivating corn, potato, grass, plum and apple. Her husband helps her in taking the agricultural products to the local market. Farming is a very important source of income for them. 

The family's daily needs are increasing with time, and Geghetsik wants to enlarge her livestock holdings to be able to meet those needs. She is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase three heifers. The loan will help her greatly to sustain the agribusiness. 

Geghetsik and her family will highly appreciate the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for the support.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and other household consumables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and other household consumables

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ella trabajando con mucho entusiasmo para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del esfuerzo de cada una. Quieren poder dar a sus familias lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La señora Mariana es presidenta del comité de Mujeres, está casada y tiene hijos, por quienes se está esforzando ya que quiere poder darles lo que ella no tuvo. En conjunto con su esposo están luchando por su familia para poder darles una vida digna.
La Sra. Mariana tiene una despensa en su casa y el crédito que recibe lo quiere invertir en la compra de verduras, carnes, bebidas, frutas y demás, para poder seguir con sus ventas y dar a sus clientes lo que piden, a la vez que tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this communal bank do a variety of jobs, each of them working with great enthusiasm to be able to help their families through their own efforts.  They want to be able to give their families what they themselves couldn’t have.  Señora Mariana is president of the women’s communal bank.  She is married and has children.  It is for them that she is exerting herself, because she wants to give them what she didn’t have.  Together with her spouse, she is fighting for her family, to be able to give them a respectable life.

Señora Mariana has a small grocery store in her house, and she wants to invest the loan she receives in purchasing vegetables, meats, drinks, fruits, and other items, to be able to continue her sales and give her customers what they ask for, while at the same time having an income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, drinks, fruit, and other items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 75 years old and married. She has three children, with ages ranging from 26 years to 40 years. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops to sell. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of clean and sufficient drinking water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy iron sheets for a tank and gutters to support it. She will be able to harvest rain water for domestic use during the rain season. 

She hopes that in the future, she will never lack drinking water. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy iron sheets and gutters to catch rain water

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He is 43 years old and married, with six children. 

He owns a small retail business in Mariakani town, and his business has been in operation for the past two years. He started the business from his own savings made over the years. The business has been growing since then. He knew Milango through friends who invited him to join so that he could save and be able to access credit to fund his business. 

He now seeks a loan to buy shaving machines and other electronics for his business. He hopes his business will grow into a stable business in the next five years, despite the usual challenges of price changes, inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs. 

He will use the extra income to educate his children and buy some piece of land for the family.

loans.use: to buy shaving machines and other electronics to sell

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Mercedes está empezando a trabajar, ellas son mujeres muy entusiastas que están con muchas esperanzas de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo y la unión de todas ellas. Están haciendo también la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y limpieza de cutis, también se debe destacar lo entusiasta que es, ya que está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia, es muy trabajadora y quiere seguir creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos de belleza variados y así seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo y mejorando su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The "Las Mercedes" group is starting to work. These women are very enthusiastic with a lot of hope that they can help their families through their work and collaboration with each other. They are also involved in the Poverty Stopwatch survey in order to work. 

One of the members is Liz who sells cosmetics and does facials. It is important to point out how enthusiastic she is. She is putting her all into improving her life and that of her family. She is very hard-working and wants to continue growing. 

Liz is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of a variety of beauty products in order to continue with her sales. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving so she can continue expanding and improving her micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beauty products.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 45-years-old man and is married. He has four children, 16, 12, 8 and 4 years old, whom he supports. Alfred is a coconut supplier. He has been in this business, which is located at Matsangoni, for 11 years. From this business he earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

Alfred was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET officer. He is taking his third loan of 10,000 KES, which he intends to use to buy more coconuts to sell to his customers. He paid back his previous loan of 10,000 KES successfully. Alfred will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hope and dream for the future of his business and family is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Despite the difficulties in maintaining revenue-generating businesses, these members are very courageous and fairly robust in their determination. They number three, and they sell home appliances, foodstuffs, and clothing.  

Richard is the male in this group and the featured borrower.  He is 35 years old and married, the father of two children (a girl and a boy). 

His business involves the sale of home electrical appliances, which he sells to customers in Dansoman. He purchases them from the wholesaler and sells at retail.

With this loan amount of GHS 1,500, he intends to purchase more appliances to sell to customers. 

The profits will be used to manage his family's day to day expenses, and some of it will go into his savings account.

Together, the group needs a total amount of GHS 2,700 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more appliances to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bana 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BANA 1 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec  Yapiré  assise en première  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de peits ruminats et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "BANA 1" are all married women, who average 36 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make the plant beds for their farm work. 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work during the present rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution after having correctly repaid the first one.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Yapiré, who is sitting first from the right in the photo.With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers. She plans on making a profit of 40,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help her husband to cover family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to invest the rest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Мошариф родилась в 1961 года. Она вместе со своей семьей преодолела много трудности жизни. Она переехала вместе с мужем и единственной дочерью в другой район, так как они в своем районе не имели постоянное место работы. Переехав на другой район, они смогли найти место работы. Однако после нескольких лет ее муж умер, и она осталась без кормильца. Мошариф работала посудамойщицей в столовой. У нее была маленькая зарплата. Мошариф сильно заболела, так как она была в депрессии. Она долго лечилась. Несмотря на плохое состояние здоровья, она начала свой бизнес купле продажей женской одежды, так как она должна была прокормить свою дочь. Она выдала замуж свою дочь. Мошариф хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки женской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mosharif was born in 1961.  She and her family overcame many hardships in life.  She and her husband and their only daughter moved to another district because they did not have regular jobs in their district.  Having moved to another district, they were able to find a place of employment.  However, her husband passed away after several years, and she was left without a provider.  Mosharif worked as a dishwasher at a cafeteria.  She had a small salary.  Mosharif got seriously ill because she was depressed.  She was being treated for a long time.  Despite the bad state of her health, she started her own business of buying and selling women's clothing because she had to raise her daughter.  She has since married off her daughter.  Mosharif wants to increase her working capital.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni to purchase women's clothing.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing in order to increase working capital

loans.name: Kundane Group

texts.fr:
Gérard  fait partie du groupe Kundane  et  habite à  Cibitoke. Il  a 27 ans et est marié  à Violette, un commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant  de 10 mois.

Il  fait commerce  de cafétéria(lait,pain,...) depuis 8 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il   obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  du lait  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait mettre en place un bistrot et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Gérard is part of the group Kundane and lives in Cibitoke. He is 27 years old and married to Violette, a merchant. Together they have a 10-month-old child. 

Gérard has been in business running a cafeteria (milk, bread, …) for eight years. 

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase some milk to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to establish a bistro and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase milk to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme célibataire de 31ans. Elle est coiffeuse et exerce son métier depuis 2009 dans son atelier. Elle demande un troisième prêt auprès de WAGES pour la vente des produits cosmétiques et épargner pour avoir un atelier plus grand  et se lancer dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: Afi is a 31-year-old woman who is unmarried. She is a hairdresser and has been working at her trade since 2009 in a salon. She is asking for a third loan from WAGES to sell cosmetics and to save money in order to have a bigger salon and to start off her life in marriage.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Amah est une femme de 49ans et mariée et à un conducteur de taxi. Elle a 2 enfants dont le premier a 30ans et le dernier 13 ans tous les deux scolarisés. Elle exerce son activité depuis 2010, et revend de l’huile de palme, de la farine fermentée et divers à tous chez elle à la maison. Pour difficulté de transport, elle demande son quatrième prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter de nouveaux stocks de marchandises et réinvestir dans son activité pour avoir plus de bénéfices. Elle compte créer d’autres activités génératrices de revenus pour elle et assurer une bonne condition de vie des membres de sa famille.
texts.en: Amah is a 49-year-old woman who is married to a taxi driver. She has two children, of whom the oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 13. Both have had education. Amah has been running her business since 2010 selling palm oil, fermented flour, and a variety of other goods all at her house. Due to transportation problems, she is asking for her fourth loan from WAGES to purchase a new stock of merchandise and to reinvest in her business, so as to earn more profit. She plans on creating other revenue-generating businesses for herself and ensuring good living conditions for the members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, flour, and other products to sell

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara lives in the village of Zeda Dagva. She is 55 years old, married and lives with her husband, Tamaz.

The source of income for the family is an agricultural business. They have a small vineyard and a plot of land where citrus, nuts, and maize are grown. Tamara sells the harvested products at the local open market. 

Tamaz works as a watchman at the local school, and gets nearly $60 per month. 

Tamara and her husband decided to start a new business as their existing income wasn't enough for the family. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With the loan, Tamara will purchase a car and her husband will service the local people as a taxi driver. They also will use the car in trading, and save the transportation costs of their harvested products. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Along with the above-mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to use as a taxi

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Kongowea area, north of Mombasa, Kenya. He is 24 years old, and he is a husband and a father of one. 

He owns a farm where he practices poultry farming, and he started this business a year ago. The major product he sells is eggs. He also buys second hand goods, and sells them.  He has one employee in the business that helps him. He hopes that the business will continue to grow, despite the challenges of competition that he faces. 

He learned of Milango through friends who asked him to join so that he could save and be able to ask for credit in the future to expand his business operations. 

He now seeks a loan to buy chicken feed for the poultry. He will use the income raised to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for the poultry.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a farmer from Lorut village of the Lori region. He lives with his wife and two school-age sons (14 and 15 years old). He is extensively engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding livestock of sheep, pigs, piglets, and hens, and in cultivation of grass. Karen sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

Agribusiness is the only source of income for the family. To be able to run it in a more efficient way, Karen needs to buy agricultural machinery. A loan of USD 2,500 will help him reach his goal, enabling him to purchase agricultural machinery. With the help of the latter, Karen's agribusiness will be more organized. 

He and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Jeans

texts.en:
Jeans is a married man with two children. He comes from Nyabikamba cell. He deals in the coffee trade. His main challenge is the dry weather and competition in the village. 

He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to help him buy more stock of coffee before many traders come to villages looking for coffee. Stocking this coffee early enough will help him compete with others for a better market and good money. This will help him continue in the coffee business without making a U turn. 

He hopes to construct a permanent house for his family if business stays stable and also send his children to good schools.

loans.use: to buy coffee from farmers for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has eight children, ranging in age from 12 to 23. She describes herself to be humble and respectful. 

Mary operates a green grocery where she sells tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a water storage facility. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility, so her family will be able to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future, she will expand and diversify her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Anselme

texts.fr: Anselme est un homme de 50 ans, marié et père de famille. Après sa formation, il a ouvert une menuiserie qu'i gère depuis quelques années. Il se debrouille mais n'a pas un bon capital pour acheter son matériel pour la fabrication, des meubles qu'il revend souvent. C'est pour celà qu'il sollicite ce crédit pour s'acheter les planches. ceci augmentera ses ventes, ainsi que ses bénéfices. bénéfices qui seront réinvestis dans son activté pour l'agrandir.
texts.en: Anselme is a 50-year-old man who is married and a father. After finishing his training, he opened a carpentry shop, which he has been running for a few years. He manages to get by, but his capital is often not good enough for purchasing the supplies and equipment needed to make the furniture he sells. For this reason, he is requesting this loan to purchase lumber, and this will increase his sales and therefore his profits, which will be reinvest in his business to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase lumber to make furniture

loans.name: Edjiwengatuwa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Edjiwengatuwa está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de una ciudad alejada de la  zona de Curuguaty que aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Margarita es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien por medio de su pequeño negocio que es una despensa, viene ayudando a su familia para darles todo lo que necesitan para el día a día. Es una persona muy luchadora, que comenta que empezó con  muy poco, pero que luego por medio de su trabajo ha crecido.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, verduras, carne, pollo, queso y demás y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Edjiwengatuwa is in its first cycle of the women entrepreneurs program. They are from a city far from the area of Curuguaty which still growing. It’s an area difficult to access which is why the members of this group want to fight to grow and to give the area where they live a better environment so that it continues to slowly grow.

Margarita is one of the members of this group. Through her own small store she helps her family by providing them with their daily necessities. She is a fighter who says she started with very little but later through her work has grown.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies for her store such as drinks, vegetables, beef, chicken, among other items. This way, she can continue offering a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, vegetables, beef, chicken, among other items.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Unión está en su ciclo 25, son un grupo muy emprendedor y que fueron creciendo de apoco, así son todas las señoras muy emprendedoras y quieren avanzar más motivo por el cual incorporaron  actividades varias aparte de sus actividades actuales.
Ana es la presidenta, una mujer muy humilde, pero que sabe llevar su puesto, siempre motiva a sus compañeras a seguir luchando para mejorar sus vidas. Ella se dedica al reciclado de productos en general, como plásticos, papeles, cartones y demás, los que recolecta de manera ambulante. Comenta que es un trabajo sacrificado, pero por sobre todo honesto, con el que ayuda a su familia. Quiere seguir luchando ya que de esa forma su familia tiene las comodidades básicas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de materiales reciclados para revenderlos y tener su ganancia, como ser papeles, cartones, aluminio y demás.
texts.en:
This group, called La Unión, is on their 25th loan. They are a very entrepreneurial group and have grown from very little. All of the women are very entrepreneurial and want to advance, which is what motivated them to incorporate various businesses different from their own jobs.

Ana is the president. She is a very humble woman, but she knows how to use her position. She always motivates her colleagues to continue fighting to improve their lives. She makes a living by recycling products like plastic, paper, cardboard, and other things, which she collects as she walks. She remarks that it is a demanding job, but it is honest above all, and she is able to help her family. 

She wants to continue working since, this way, her family will be able to have basic commodities. She requests this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of recycled materials like paper, cardboard, aluminum, etc. so that she can re-sell them and earn money.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to re-sell, like paper, cardboard, aluminum, etc.

loans.name: Dimbily 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DIMBILY 2 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec  Oumou Issa  assise en première  position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 32.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "DIMBILY 2" are all married women, who average 39 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their second loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Oumou Issa, who is sitting first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 32,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses and to reinvest the rest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 41 years old and married, with two children. She owns a scrap metal business that she has been running for the last ten years now. She also owns a motorbike that carries people in town and earn her extra income. The business has grown from its inception and she has been able to employ two people who help her run the business. She hopes that her business will grow in the next five years despite inflation changes and transportation challenges. 

Juliana learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy more scrap metal for sale. She will use the income that she raises to educate her children and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said lives in the Likoni area south of Mombasa, Kenya. He is 33 years old, a husband, and father of three. He runs a food cafe in his neighbourhood. The business has been in operation for the last two years. He knew Milango through friends who invited him to join so that he could access credit to fund his business. He now seeks a loan to buy drinks and food stuff for the business. He will use the extra income that he will earn to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy drinks and food stuff

loans.name: Sylvie Michelle

texts.fr: Sylvie est une jeune femme de 29 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant qui va à l'école. Elle a également à sa charge deux autres personnes. Elle fait la teinture à son domicile des vêtements de toutes sortes qu'elle revend depuis 11 ans déjà.Son activité fonctionne à merveille grâce à la bonne qualité de ses services et à son expérience dans ce domaine elle a acquise une clientèle considérable.Mais le souci est qu'elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de cette clientèle à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter les produits en détails pour satisfaire une vague et attendre qu'elle soit payée par celle-ci pour pouvoir satisfaire l'autre vague. D'où la nécessité de ce crédit qui l'aidera à acheter son matériel en gros pour travailler et lui permettra de satisfaire toute sa clientèle,d'augmenter ses bénéfices.Elle économisera une partie de ce profit pour ouvrir une boutique avec le temps et l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Sylvie is a young 29-year-old woman who is married and the mother of a child who attends school. She also supports two other people. She has worked from home for 11 years, dyeing all kinds of clothing which she then resells. Her business is very successful due to the good quality of her services, as well as her experience in this area, which has helped her build up a considerable customer base. Sylvie’s concern, however, is that she will not be able to meet the needs of these customers, as her capital is so low. This means she has to buy products on a retail basis to meet one wave of demand, before waiting to be paid before she is able to meet the needs of more customers. She therefore needs a loan to help her buy bulk material to use for her work, allowing her to meet all her customers’ needs and increase her income. She will save part of this profit to open a store over time, and the other portion of her profits will help her to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To buy bulk dyeing materials.

loans.name: Magombe

texts.en: Magombe is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be future-oriented and enthusiastic. She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She describes her biggest business challenge to be water shortage. She will use the 26,180 KES loan to buy a water tank to store sufficient water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, her standards of living will improve. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her last loan of 15,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru:
Животноводство - самое распространенное занятие в сельской местности. Почти у каждого хозяйство имеется хотя бы один теленок или барашка. Этим же занятием занимается и  Нилуфар постоянная клиентка МДО "Арванд". Нилуфар трудолюбивая, мужественная женщина. Ей 35 лет. Замужем. Мать троих детей. Муж Нилуфара   добрый, заботливый.  Он всегда поддерживает свою жену, в беде её не оставит. Гулом работает  автослесарем. Дополнительный доход у них от выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. 
Сама Нилуфар очень любит животных. С детства она наблюдала как её родители ухаживали за скотами. Когда она подросла твердо решила заняться животноводством, и по сей день Нилуфар продолжает это дело. Нилуфар вот уже несколько лет подряд берет кредит в МДО "Арванд". С поддержкой организации она увеличила поголовье своих скатов. И вот в очередной раз Нилуфар подала заявку на кредит для покупки скота. Она выражает свою благодарность Арванд.
texts.en: Animal husbandry is the most common business in a rural area.  Almost every household has at least one calf or a lamb.  Nilufar, a regular client of MDO Arvand, is also involved in this type of business.  Nilufar is a hardworking and strong woman.  She is 35 years old, married and a mother of three children.  Nilufar's husband is kind and caring.  He always supports his wife and would never leave her in trouble.  Gulom works as an auto mechanic.  They earn an additional income from growing agricultural crops.  Nilufar loves animals very much.  She has watched her parents take care of livestock since her childhood.  When she grew up, she decided with certainty to get involved in animal husbandry, and to this day, Nilufar continues this business.  Nilufar has requested loans from MDO Arvand consistently for several years.  She increased her livestock headcount with the help of this organization.  And once again, Nilufar requested a loan to buy livestock.  She expresses her gratitude to Arvand.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación en la que cada una se encuentra y conforme a eso poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delia  quien es una persona muy sacrificada que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Por medio de la Venta de Ropas de temporada, está pudiendo mejorar su economía y la de su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de lencería, con lo que podrá seguir con sus ventas y dar a sus clientes una mayor variedad y seguir luchando por mejorar. En la foto aparecen 20 mujeres, ya que el grupo esta integrado por 20 mujeres, pero ahora solo retiran 19 de ellas.
texts.en:
The group San Cayetano is currently in its 5th cycle with the committee's program. All members of this group are participating in an ongoing survey for poverty elimination, to be able to assess the financial situation in which each member is, and work accordingly.

One of the members is Delia, a very hardworking person who is getting ahead with a lot of dedication. By selling seasonal clothing she is improving her financial situation and the economy of her family. Delia is requesting this loan to purchase lingerie to continue with her sales, offering diverse merchandise to her clients, and improving her situation overall.

There are 20 women present in this picture, as the group has 20 members; however, for this specific cycle only 19 of them will be participating.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for her clothing business.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Isidro, está en su ciclo  2° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están muy entusiasmadas en trabajar en equipo para poder ayudar a sus familias. Tienen un gran entusiasmo y quieren ayudarse las unas a las otras para un crecimiento no solo económico.
Doris es parte del grupo, ella es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropas que ella misma trae de la ciudad de Asunción. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada, su jornada empieza todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, luchando cada día por mejorar su economía y la de su familia, y su meta es poder tener una tienda de ropas algún día.
La Sra. Doris Solicita  este crédito para la compra de prendas de verano variadas lo cual  la ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio y ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes, y también poder atraer a nuevos.
texts.en:
The San Isidro group, a women's committee, is on its second loan. They are very excited to work as a team to be able to help their families. They are very enthusiastic and want to help each other to grow, not just financially.

Doris is part of this group. She is a merchant and sells clothing that she takes to the city of Asunción herself. She is a very selfless person. Her work day begins very early every day, and she fights each day to improve her and her family's economic situation. Her goal is to someday have her own clothing store.

Doris requests this loan to purchase summer clothing, which will help her to finalize her business plan, offer a good variety to her customers, and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dimbily 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DIMBILY 1 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec  Fatouma   assise en première  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 30.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "DIMBILY 1" are all married women, who average 40 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work. 

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their second loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Fatouma, who is sitting first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 30,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to reinvest the rest in their work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Sakua's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two persons from the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, Sakua, is 34 years old.

Sakua Sophie has had very little schooling. She is married and has three children. All of her chidlren attend school and are dependents of their parents. Sakua lives with her children and husband. Various family expenses are borne by the couple.

To make ends meet, Sakua has been selling wigs and weavon for six years. She buys them from the market in Ghana. In order to strengthen her business, Sakua joins the other member of her group in requesting a sixth loan from ID Ghana.

loans.use: To buys wigs and weavon from the market in Ghana

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with two wives and he is 56 years old. He has fifteen children. Six of them go to school and the rest are helping their parents on the farm. 

John's business is cattle fattening. His major problem is the dry season, when the place gets dry and there is no grass and water for the animals. He has to move long distances in search of water and grass. He hopes to construct a dam to store water so that his animals can get water to drink during the dry season.

John has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to help him pay tuition fees for his son, who is in university, since his cattle are still too young for sale. He will use the rest of the money to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his son at university and to buy more cattle for fattening

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
El Sr Aldo tiene, 31 años el proviene de una Familia de comerciante, su papa tiene una despensa y su mama es ama de casa.
Él se animó y con la ayuda de su familia se independizo hace 2  años y montó su propio negocio de venta de artículos en general, comenta que le va muy bien en su local y que ya gano muy buena clientela.
Manifiesta además que aprendió mucho donde estaba como vendedor y cobrador en una casa comercial para administrar y llevar adelante un negocio del ramo
Esta muy contento por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda. El quiere comprar licuadoras y colchones para poder venderlos y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Aldo, 31, comes from a family of merchants.  His father has a store and his mother’s a housewife.  With his family’s encouragement he ventured to start his own business two years ago selling general merchandise and he comments that he does very well in his shop and has acquired a very good clientele already.

He states that he also learned much about managing and moving a business forward while employed in a commercial firm as a salesman and bill collector.

He’s very happy with the opportunity he’s getting because it will be of great help for him.  He wants to buy blenders and mattresses to sell and continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy blenders and mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Bana 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BANA 2 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Korka   debout en deuxième  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de peits ruminats et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "BANA 2" are all married women, who average 35 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work. 

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their second loan with the institution after having correctly paid back the first one.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Korka, who is standing second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 60,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to reinvest the rest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BANA 3 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali.

Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec    Fatouma    debout en première  position à gauche sur la photo.

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 30.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.

The members of the group "BANA 3" are all married women, who average 41 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work. 

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their second loan with the institution after having correctly paid back the first one.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Fatouma, who is standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 30,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to reinvest the rest in their work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Bana 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BANA 4 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 8 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec    Ourgatou    debout en deuxième  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "BANA 4" are all married women, who average 41 years of age and eight children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work. 

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their second loan with the institution after having correctly paid back the first one.
