The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Ourgatou, who is standing second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 40,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to reinvest the rest in their work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Mkwajuni, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion-fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Peter is married and has three children. Both he and his wife are farmers, who are currently farming passion fruit on their land. 

Peter is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because it represents a “sustainable utilization of natural forests” and will also “increase crop production through pollination.”

This is Peter’s first loan from Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Deiver Fernando

texts.es: Deiver es un campesino de 38 años de edad, casado y padre de 2 hijos. Nació en el seno de una familia campesina muy humilde y desde pequeño conoció todas las labores del campo, pues es una tradición familiar; hace algún tiempo trabajó como empleado en una finca lechera y luego pasó a ser mayordomo de otra finca de la región, allí aplica todos sus conocimientos en las labores agrícolas; adicionalmente trabaja como independiente, pues posee ganado de levante ubicado en la finca de una hermano allí cuida y engorda los animales para luego venderlos y así complementar su salario para llevar el sustento a su familia. El cliente es un hombre pujante, activo y luchador, su perseverancia le ha permitido conseguir nuevas alternativas para salir adelante, es por ello que se motiva a solicitar su sexto ciclo de crédito; el dinero será destinado para la compra de más ganado de levante y para cancelar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente; esto le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo y aumentar su producción, con esto logrará mejorar las ventas y los ingresos que recibe por ellas. Deiver sueña con fortalecer y ampliar su negocio, generando nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida para disfrutar al lado de su esposa e hijos, de un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Deiver is a 38-year-old farmer. He is married and father to 2 children. He was born into a very humble family of farmers. Since he was little he has known all the work on the farm, as it’s a family tradition. 

He was an employee on a dairy farm for a while and later became a supervisor on another farm in the region. He applies all his knowledge of agriculture there. In addition, he works for himself; he has livestock on his brother’s farm. He takes care of and fattens the animals in order to later sell them to supplement his income to support his family. He is a driven, active and vigorous man. His perseverance has allowed him to follow new options to come out ahead, motivating him to request his sixth loan.

The loan will be to purchase more cattle and to pay off a loan that is current. This will allow him to increase his working capital and production. With this loan he will manage to improve his sales and income that he receives. 
 
Deiver dreams of strengthening and expanding his business, generating new employment opportunities and improving the quality of life to enjoy with his wife and children; for a better well-being.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and to pay off a loan that is current.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 42 years old and married, with five children. 

He has a very big coffee plantation where he harvests 10 bags of coffee every season. His customers are his neighbors. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to help him buy a piece of land also with coffee on it. It will help him harvest more coffee for the trade. His challenge is the weather that affects the coffee during the dry season, thus getting poor yields to his customers. 

His hopes are to produce 50 bags of coffee every season and also to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 5 Group

texts.en:
Yuberkis is the coordinator of her group Fuerza Divina (divine force) 5. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. 

She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She runs a business selling food.

Yuberkis started her business with the first loan she received from Esperanza. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of stocks of rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, and other goods. 

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, she wants to have a successful grocery store (or colmado, as we call it). 

She tells us her biggest challenge has been to build her house.  When she starts to receive a better income, she will build her house and help her long-term partner with expenses. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Lef Akeh Group

texts.en:
Emma is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Emma was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone 35 years ago. She is married to a businessman, and the couple has five children, four of whom are attending primary and secondary school. 

For six years now, Emma has been selling soft drinks, rum, and building materials. She and her group members have applied for a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to expand their businesses. 

Emma will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy more soft drinks, rum, and building materials in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rum, and building materials in bulk to sell

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer está en su tercer ciclo, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación en la que cada una está en el ámbito general de sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz quien está trabajando arduamente para poder mejorar sus ingresos y su vida,  ella es muy luchadora y trabajadora. Comenta que tiene una despensita bien surtida con todo tipo de insumos para poder surtir a sus clientes y vecinos.
Ella es una mujer que quiere seguir creciendo, es por ello que pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificaos, arroz, bebidas, aceite, remedios, tomate, cebolla, etc, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Renacer" group is on their third loan. They are currently completing the poverty elimination program, so that they can find out about the situation in which each person finds herself.

One of the members is Liz, who is working hard to be able to improve her income and her life. She is very determined and hardworking. She mentions that she has a small, well-stocked general store with all kinds of supplies to provide to her customers and neighbors. She is a woman who wants to continue to grow. For this reason, she requests this loan to invest in the purchase of sugar, noodles, meat, bread, rice, drinks, oil, medicine, tomatoes, onions, etc., so that she can continue to stock her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, noodles, meat, milk, bread, rice, drinks, oil, medicine, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña guapa está empezando a trabajar juntas, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que tienen como meta poder ayudarse las unas a las otras para mejorar la vida de cada una y la de su familia.
La Sra. Rocioes la tesorera  del grupo, ella es ama de casa pero quiere vender ropas, y poder emprender de esa forma una actividad para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella es solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todas clases, para poder emprender su negocio y así ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” group is starting to work together.  They are all female heads of household whose goal is to help each other out in order to improve each of their lives and their families’.

Rocío is group treasurer.  She’s a housewife but wants to sell clothes to start an activity to be able to help her family.

She’s asking for this loan to buy all kinds of clothes to start her business thus helping her family by means of her work.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: The Star Group

texts.en:
Hadiatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hadiatu was born in Sanda village, in northern Sierra Leone 26 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children, who are attending primary schools. 

For five years now, Hadiatu has been selling earrings, chains, wallets, etc. She and her group members have applied for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. 

Hadiatu will use her share of the loan to buy jewelry, wallets, etc., in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, wallets, etc., in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Santa Librada se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, están en su ciclo 7, donde están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder superar su pobreza. Ellas están muy contentas por formar parte del grupo.
Regina es pate de este grupo, ella tiene un kiosco bien surtido con todo tipo de productos. Gracias a que es muy buena con sus ventas se ha hecho de muy buena clientela y hoy ya es muy conocida en el barrio. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y tener algún día un gran negocio.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de golosinas, galletitas, jugos, comestibles y demás insumos. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de gran ayuda. En la foto del grupo aparecen mas personas, ya que son 19 mujeres las que integran el grupo, pero solo 17 retiran crédito en este ciclo.
texts.en:
The group 'Santa Librada', established in the city of  Encarnación, is currently in its 7th cycle and the members are making remarkable efforts to overcome poverty. They are all very happy to be part of the group. 

Regina, a member of this group, runs a small shop that offers a wide variety of products. She is a good saleswoman and thus she has built a good clientele and is now well known in the neighborhood. Her goal is to continue to grow and one day own a big business. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying candy, biscuits, juices, snacks and various supplies. She is grateful for this opportunity, which will help her a lot. 

There are 19 women present in this picture, as the group has 19 members; however, for this specific loan only 17 of them will be participating.

loans.use: to buy candy, biscuits, juices, snacks and various supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Mbaapo Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Mbaapo, inician el  primer ciclo del programa de comité. Ellas están muy esperanzadas en que por medio del grupo cada una de ellas pueda mejorar sus vidas y también poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una persona digna de destacar es Zonia, quien es muy luchadora y por medio de su esfuerzo está ayudando a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano, y comenta que le va muy bien ya que últimamente estas prendas son muy apreciadas y más económicas. Ella quiere poder tener un negocio grande de prendas y poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas usadas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Mbaapo” group is starting its first cycle in the committee program.  They are very hopeful that by means of the group each one of them can improve her life and also be able to help their families.

One of the people worthy of note is Zonia who is very hardworking and by means of her efforts is helping her family.  She works selling second-hand clothes and comments that she does very well because her articles of clothing have become quite sought-after and affordable lately.  She wants to be able to have a larger clothing business and be able to offer employment to other people.

She’s asking for this loan to buy used clothes to be able to continue with her sales.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting that will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dimbily 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DIMBILY 3 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  47 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme  Kadidia Amadou  assise en troisième  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 23.500  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "DIMBILY 3" are all married women, who average 47 years of age and seven children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their first loan with the institution.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Ms. Kadidia Amadou, who is sitting third from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 23,500 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses and to reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Dimbily 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DIMBILY 4 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme  Salmata  assise en première  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 24000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "DIMBILY 4" are all married women, who average 42 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their first loan with the institution.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Ms. Salmata, who is sitting first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 24,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses and to reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Leidy Tatiana

texts.es: Leidy es una joven emprendedora de 23 años de edad, que debido a la falta de experiencia laboral le ha sido difícil emplearse en una empresa, por lo que desde hace 3 años decidió emprender su camino en el campo del comercio independiente, vendiendo ropa para niños y productos nutricionales de una marca muy reconocida a nivel mundial; la idea surgió de una amiga que le sugirió comenzar esta actividad y, poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia y dándose a conocer en el sector. Su espíritu de superación, su energía y entusiasmo la llevan a buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitan salir adelante; por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea abastecerse de mercancía al por mayor (ropa para bebés y niños de 1 a 6 años) y productos nutricionales (batidos, malteadas dietéticas, vitaminas, multivitamínicos, entre otros), así podrá tener más variedad de inventario para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta con la llegada de la temporada de navidad, incrementando también sus ingresos económicos. De esta manera Leidy desea seguir trabajando para acreditar y fortalecer su negocio y, en un futuro poder cumplir el sueño de montar su propio almacén de ropa y accesorios para bebés y niños, pues le apasiona su labor y ve en ella una buena fuente de ingresos para garantizar a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leidy, 23, is a young entrepreneur for whom finding employment in a firm was difficult because of her lack of experience.  Therefore, three years ago she decided to start her own independent commercial path selling children’s clothes and nutritional products from a world-renowned firm.  The idea arose thanks to a friend who suggested she go into this activity and she gradually acquired experience and became known in the sector.

Her self-improvement spirit, energy and enthusiasm lead her to seek new alternatives to move forward and this is why she’s requesting the loan she wants to use to stock up on merchandise at wholesale (baby clothes and clothes for children aged 1-6) and nutritional products (blended drinks, diet shakes, vitamins, multivitamins, etc.)  In this way she’ll have a more varied inventory on-hand to meet demand that rises with the arrival of Christmas and her income will rise accordingly.

Leidy wants to continue working to become well-known and to strengthen her business so that in future she can reach her dream of opening her clothing and children's and infant's accessories store for she’s passionate about her work and sees it as a good source of income to ensure her family’s favorable economic stability and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: San Salvador Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Salvador está iniciando en el programa de comité de la fundación, ellas han visto una gran oportunidad de crecer en el programa, y es por ello que se unieron, son mujeres jefas de familias, que luchan y quieren mejorar sus vidas.
Maura trabaja en la venta de leche, ella trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que su producto debe de estar temprano para la hora del desayuno. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y luchando por darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan.
Pide de este crédito para que así pueda comprar más leche y siga con sus ventas. Ella es una persona muy dedicada y quiere seguir luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called San Salvador is starting in the committee program of the foundation. They have had a great opportunity to grow in the program and for this reason, they have come together. They are women and heads of families who are struggling and want improve their lives.
Maura sells milk. She works very early, every day, since the product has to be ready for breakfast. Her goal is to be able to continue working and fighting to give her family everything that they need. She is requesting this loan to help purchase more milk and continue with her sales. She is a very dedicated person and she wants to continue striving to improve.

loans.use: purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Vivogbe Alegleta Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIVOGBE ALEGLETA est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et exercent des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante du groupe, nommée Souhou Rachelle (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 43 ans. Souhou Rachelle a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Souhou Rachelle est mariée à un certain Ousman. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Souhou Rachelle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de ménage. C'est pour cette raison que Souhou Rachelle vend des sacs, des chaussures et des pommades à son domicile depuis une dizaine d'années. Souhou Rachelle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Souhou Rachelle s’associe aux autres membres du groupe VIVOGBE ALEGLETA pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group VIVOGBE ALEGLETA comprises five persons who reside in the same district and who run revenue-generating businesses. The group's representative, Souhou Rachelle (with her hand raised in the photo), is 43 years old. She has a middle school education and is married to a man named Ousman. The couple have four children, all in school, and two are in their care. She lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

For this reason, Souhou Rachelle has been selling bags, shoes, and ointments out of her home for about ten years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her business, she joined with the other members of the group VIVOGBE ALEGLETA to request a third loan from ALIDé. The previous ones were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase handbags, shoes, and ointments to sell

loans.name: Les Sœurs Unies Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LES SŒURS UNIES est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Ablawa Léa Claire (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 53 ans. Ablawa Léa Claire est mariée à un certain Sylvain. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Ablawa Léa Claire vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Ablawa Léa Claire et son mari. Pour ce faire Ablawa Léa Claire vend des tissus et des bijoux à son domicile depuis vingt ans. Ablawa Léa Claire s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ablawa Léa Claire s’associe aux autres membres du groupe LES SŒURS UNIES pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group LES SŒURS UNIES comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Ablawa Léa Claire (with her hand raised in the photo), is 53 years old and married to a man named Sylvain. The couple have four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children. The household expenses are covered by her and her husband. To do so, Ablawa Léa Claire has been selling cloth and jewelry out of her home for twenty years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business, Ablawa Léa Claire joined with the other members of the group LES SŒURS UNIES to request a second loan from ALIDé. The previous one was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mónica Yuliana

texts.es: Mónica, a sus 27 años de edad, es una mujer casada y madre de 2 hijos. Desde hace algún tiempo inició su propio negocio en compañía de su esposo, una ferretería en un barrio popular de la ciudad, siendo empírica en esta labor, ella comenzó a tomar clases de contabilidad, lo que le ha permitido ser más organizada con el manejo de su unidad productiva y, así ha generado los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. SU empuje, empeño y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante y por ello, se anima a solicitar el crédito como apoyo para surtir su negocio, con el dinero comprará mercancía al por mayor (clavos, tornillos, tuercas, alicates, pinzas, entre otros), esto le permitirá ampliar la variedad de su inventario y así satisfacer todas las necesidades de sus clientes, mejorando notablemente su nivel de ventas y sus ingresos.  De esta manera Mónica desea seguir luchando para dar continuidad a su negocio, pues su sueño es fortalecerlo y acreditarlo para que sea más rentable y perdure en el tiempo, generando mejores ingresos para tener la oportunidad de culminar sus estudios universitarios y poder aplicar todo su conocimiento en el crecimiento de su proyecto productivo, mejorando además el bienestar y la calidad de vida de todos los que ama.
texts.en:
Mónica, 27, is married and mother of two children.  She and her husband started their own business some time ago, a hardware store in one of the city’s popular neighborhoods.  She’s taught herself this work and started taking accounting courses that have helped her become better organized with her business and she’s generated enough income to help her husband with household expenses.

Her drive, effort and perseverance have made it possible for her to get ahead and this is why she’s encouraged to seek a loan to help her stock her business.  She will use the money to buy stock merchandise like nails, screws, nuts, pliers, screwdrivers, etc. at wholesale which will allow her to have a more varied inventory on-hand to meet all her customers’ needs significantly improving her sales and income levels.

In this way, Mónica hopes to continue striving to give continuity to her business for her dream is to strengthen it and make it well-known so that it will be more profitable and long-lasting generating higher income so that she can have the opportunity of completing her university studies and apply all her knowledge to her business’ growth thus improving  all her loved-ones’ well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es: Marta, con 44 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde hace 2 años inició su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes en la que ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar, se encuentra ubicada en un espacio de su casa que adecuó para poner su negocio; la idea surgió debido a la necesidad que tenía de generar ingresos para su familia, pues estaban pasando por una difícil situación económica y, con el apoyo de algunos créditos anteriores pudo sacar su proyecto productivo adelante, logrando salir de la crisis financiera y dándose a conocer en el sector donde reside.  Su perseverancia, entusiasmo y el empeño con el que realiza su labor han logrado dar una estabilidad a su familia, por ello se motiva para solicitar su cuarto ciclo de crédito, con el que comprará surtido al por mayor (verduras, mecato, lácteos, cárnicos, galletería, confitería, entre otros) y realizará unas adecuaciones locativas, esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen de su establecimiento, logrando así atraer la atención de más compradores, además podrá ofrecer más variedad de artículos para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, aumentando así sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas. De esta manera Marta desea seguir trabajando arduas jornadas y fortalecer aún más su negocio, para que siga siendo el sustento de su familia y permitir que sus hijos tengan un mejor bienestar y educación para que sean personas de bien y puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marta is 44 years old, she is a mother of 3 children and lives with her partner. She started her own business 2 years ago, a home-based grocery store offering a variety of products and staple goods. 

The idea of this business came from the need to generate income for her family, given that they were in a difficult financial situation. Thanks to the support from previous loans, she was able to open this grocery store, tackling their economic crisis while also becoming well known in her area. 

Marta has achieved economic stability for her family through her perseverance, enthusiasm, and her efforts. This is why she finds the motivation to request her fourth loan, to buy an assortment of wholesale products (vegetables, snacks, dairy products, meat, biscuits, candy, etc). In addition, she will also make improvements to her establishment, to attract more costumers. 

She will be able to offer a wider variety of products to meet her customers' needs, increasing her sales and in the long run her profits. Marta wants to continue to work hard, strengthening her business to go on supporting her family, offering good living conditions for her children and a good education, so that they become good citizens and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products (vegetables, snacks, dairy products, meat, biscuits, candy, etc) and to make improvements to her business.

loans.name: Kuña Juky Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras forman parte de este grupo, todas ellas son mujeres que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estela, quien se encuentra mejorando su situación de vida, entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, donde tiene todos los insumos con los que surte a sus vecinos y otros clientes, ella lucha y quiere seguir mejorando, es por eso que pide de este crédito.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos variados, como ser carne, productos a granel, bebidas, panificados y otros productos para poder surtir su despensa, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Seventeen very hardworking and determined women form part of this group.  They are all women who want to improve living conditions for themselves and their families.  

One of the members is Estela, who is improving her living situation.  Among the work that she does, she says that she has a well-stocked store, where she has all the supplies that she provides to her neighbors and other customers.  She works hard and wants to continue advancing, which is why she is asking for this loan.

She is applying for this loan to purchase various consumables, such as meat, bulk goods, drinks, baked goods and other products for stocking her store.  This will help solidify her business plan, which will help her improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy meat, bulk goods, drinks, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: 15 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “15 de agosto”  está en su ciclo número 9º del programa de comité, donde todas quieren ir trabajando y mejorando su vida. Ellas son conocidas en el barrio por ser muy organizadas y trabajan todas unidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Evelia, quien vende comidas que ella misma hace, es muy conocida en su barrio por las delicias que ofrece, y así ha hecho de mucha clientela. Su sueño es poder seguir con sus ventas y poder tener un mayor ingreso que poder usar para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, y así seguir con sus ventas, luchando por su familia y por crecer. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de seguir creciendo. En la foto del grupo aparecen mas personas, ya que son 17 las integrantes, pero 5 de ellas solo integran y esta vez no sacan ningún crédito
texts.en:
The group called “15 de Agosto” (August 15) is in cycle #9 in the committee program where they all want to continue working and improving their lives.  They are known in the neighborhood for being very well organized and for working well together.

One of the members is Evelia who sells food she prepares herself.  She’s very well known in the neighborhood because of the delicacies she offers.  She’s acquired a large clientele and her dream is to be able to continue with her sales and to be able to earn higher income she can use to help her family.

She’s asking for this loan to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes and continue with her sales striving for her family and to grow.  She’s grateful for the opportunity all of them are getting to continue growing.

More people appear in the photo since there are 17 members but five of them are only participating in the group but not taking out a loan this time.

loans.use: to buy food-making ingredients.

loans.name: Vivogbe Tankpe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIVOGBE TANKPE est composé de six personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Rosalie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Rosalie a très peu fréquenté l'école. Rosalie est mariée à un peintre du nom de Prosper. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rosalie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de ménage. Pour ce faire, Rosalie vend des vivres et divers produits à son domicile depuis dix huit ans environ. Rosalie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Rosalie s’associe aux autres membres du groupe VIVOGBE TANKPE pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group VIVOGBE TANKPE comprises six persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Rosalie (with her hand raised in the photo), is 42 years old and has had little schooling. She is married to a painter named Prosper. The couple have five children, all in school and in their care. She lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. To do so, Rosalie has been selling staple foods and various goods out of her home for eighteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business, Rosalie joined with the other members of the group VIVOGBE TANKPE to request a fourth loan from ALIDé. The previous ones were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase staple foods

loans.name: Be Honest Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Be Honest II” group. They are small-scale business people based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. 

They are requesting a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each member in the group. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Fatu.  Fatu is 50 years old.  She was born in Lunsar town, but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman, and her children are attending primary and secondary school. 

For seven years now, Fatu has been selling building materials. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of building materials to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of building materials to add to her business

loans.name: Jesus Misericordioso Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jesus Misericordioso está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas y cada una están poniendo de su mayor esfuerzo por crecer en el emprendimiento que hacen.
Ercilia es la presidenta de este grupo, ella siempre motiva a sus compañeras a seguir trabajando y esforzándose por mejorar sus vidas y las de sus seres queridos. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano, y conforme pase el tiempo quiere ir creciendo y mejorando su emprendimiento.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en prendas, ya que así podrá seguir creciendo y mejorando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que reciben, ya que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group Jesus Misericordioso [Jesus Merciful] is in its first semester of the Women's Committee program, where each and every one is putting forth their greatest effort to grow in their business.

Ercilia is the president of this group.  She always motivates her colleagues to continue working and striving in order to improve their lives and that of their loved ones.  She makes her living selling secondhand clothing, and as time passes, she wants to continue growing and improving her business.

She is applying for this loan to invest it in clothing, so that she can continue growing and improving.  She is grateful for this opportunity that they are getting, because it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Korkor's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of four business members, one of whom is Korkor, who is 30 years old, single and has no children. Her business for the last eight years has been selling smoked fish from her home. For four loans, ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner, has financed the group's businesses. The group needs a total amount of GHS 1600 to stock their businesses. 
Korkor is seeking the loan to buy more fish to smoke and sell to customers. 

Rosemary is 22 years old and her business is the sale of glass cups and plates. Adjei is 53 years old and a fish seller. Dora is 30 years old and a flour seller.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Héctor Mario

texts.es: Héctor es un hombre casado y padre de dos hijos de 17 y 19 años. Durante gran parte de su vida productiva se ha dedicado a la labor de la tapicería de muebles y, con la experiencia obtenida inició su propio taller en un local muy bien ubicado en el pueblo donde reside. Allí se dio a conocer en todo el pueblo y aprovechando la buena ubicación de su negocio, decidió organizar una exhibición para vender telas, pegantes, cojinería, insumos, relleno, almohadas, colchones, entre otros, con el fin de generar más ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Su empuje, experiencia y dedicación le han permitido ser reconocido en el sector, con lo que se beneficia ya que sus clientes lo refieren a otras personas y así va aumentando sus ventas. Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, pegantes, espuma, relleno, pintura, cojines, colchonetas, silletería, entre otros), de esta forma podrá trabajar con todos los insumos necesarios para satisfacer la demanda y los requerimientos de su clientela, mejorando así el nivel de ingresos con los que sostiene a su familia. Héctor desea seguir trabajando arduamente para cumplir el sueño de tener un punto de venta o galería en el mismo taller y así poder vender todos los productos que elabora, pues esto le permitirá tener mejores ingresos con los que podrá dar a sus hijos una buena educación universitaria y mejorará la calidad de vida de todo el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Héctor is married and father of two children who are 17 and 19 years old.  He’s spent a large part of his productive life as a furniture upholsterer and with the experience he acquired opened his own workshop in a very well-located spot in the town he lives in.  He became known there by everyone in town and taking advantage of his shop’s good location he decided to organize an display area to sell fabric, glue, cushion-making supplies, supplies, filling, pillows and mattresses among others aiming at generating higher income to support his home.

His drive, experience and dedication have led to his becoming well-known in the sector which is profitable for him since his customers refer him to others and his sales grow this way.

He’s currently asking for the loan to buy supplies at wholesale (fabric, adhesives, foam, filling, paint, cushions, pads, chair-making supplies, etc. to be able to have all the supplies on-hand needed to meet demand and customer needs thus improving the level of income used to support his family.

Héctor would like to continue working hard to reach his goal of owning a point of sales or gallery in his workshop to be able to sell all the items he manufactures for this will allow him to earn higher income that he will be able to use to provide his children with a good university education and will also improve his entire immediate family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Eleyour Women B Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Eleyour Women B” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 3,100,000.00 SLL for the entire group to invest in their respective businesses. 
Ayiekeh is the featured leader of this group. Ayiekeh is 45 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a fisherman and one of her children is attending secondary school. Ayiekeh sells breads and tea and has been in business for six years now. With the help of this loan, Ayiekeh will invest in her business by buying milk, butter, mayonnaise, cheese, eggs, breads, flasks, cups, teaspoons, etc. in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, butter, mayonnaise, cheese, eggs, breads, flasks, cups, teaspoons, etc. in order to boost her business

loans.name: Custom Women A Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Custom Women A” group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 
Christiana is the featured leader of this group. The 36 year old is single with no children. Christiana has been a businesswoman for four years now. She sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Ta-Tamtamneh Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Ta-Tamtamneh” group from Waterloo, a town in Western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 4,500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 
Santigie is the featured leader of this group. The 48 year old is married to a trader and the couple has five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Santigie has been a businesswoman for seven years now selling torch lights. With her share of this loan, she will buy a wide variety of torch lights to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy a wide variety of torch lights to add to her current stock

loans.name: Jonnathan Andrés

texts.es: Jonnathan, a sus 26 años de edad, es casado y aún no tiene hijos. Desde los 13 años de edad está trabajando, pues nació en una familia muy humilde, ha trabajado en construcción, vendiendo loterías en la calle y mercancía puerta a puerta por las diferentes calles de la ciudad; a medida que fue creciendo tuvo la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad y, para aumentar sus ingresos, dictaba clases de matemáticas y física. Gracias a su empuje, perseverancia, empeño y dedicación pudo convertirse en un comerciante independiente y en compañía de su esposa montaron su propio almacén de ropa (ver foto junto a su esposa), allí trabaja todos los días de 9:00 am a 9:00 pm y, de esta manera genera los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar y suplir algunas necesidades básicas. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (jeans, blusas, camisetas), así podrá abastecerse para la temporada de navidad, en la que sus ventas se incrementan y obtiene un margen de ganancia más alto, además podrá satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes. Jonnathan manifiesta que desea seguir trabajando con mucho empeño y dedicación para poder cumplir el sueño de ampliar su almacén, posicionarlo en el mercado y lograr que sea más rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, que le garantice una estabilidad económica para poder disfrutar con su esposa de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jonnathan, 26, is married with no children yet.  He’s worked since the age of 13 for he was born into a very humble family.  He’s worked in construction, selling lottery tickets in the street and merchandise door-to -door along various streets in the city.  As he grew, he got the opportunity of entering university and to increase his income he taught mathematics and physics classes.  

Thanks to his drive, perseverance, effort and dedication he was able to become an independent merchant and with his wife opened their own clothing store (see photo alongside his wife).  He works there every day from 9am until 9pm and generates income this way sufficient to provide sustenance at home and cover some basic needs.

He’s currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise like jeans, blouses and t-shirts at wholesale to stock up for the Christmas season which is when sales increase and his profit margin is larger.  He’ll also be able to meet customer needs and satisfy their wants.

Jonnathan states that he’d like to continue working with much effort and dedication to reach his dream of enlarging his store and positioning it in the marketplace in such a way that it becomes more profitable and sustainable over time to ensure economic stability so he and his wife can enjoy better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
El Sr. Fermin, es soltero, vive en casa alquilada hace varios años, recorre todo el departamento levantado pedidos y repartiendo sus productos y cuenta que hace más de 8 años que tiene experiencia en las ventas ambulantes. Gracias a su actividad ya se compró una moto y camioneta.
Su clientela está conformada principalmente por las despensas, supermercados y otros negocios que venden este tipo de productos el cual el Sr. Fermin vende al por mayor y sobre pedido.
El crédito solicitado es para compra de productos varios, en especial artículos de ferretería en general ya que está llegando la época de mayor venta y poder aprovechar los precios que le dejarán un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Fermin is single. He has been living in a rented home for several years. He travels all over his department taking orders and delivering his products, and says he has over eight years of experience as a street vendor. Thanks to his business, he has been able to buy a motorcycle and a truck. 

His customer base comprises mainly the stores, supermarkets, and other businesses that sell this type of product that Fermin sells wholesale and by order. 

He will use the requested loan to buy assorted products, particularly hardware store items. The busiest season is approaching and he wants to be able to take advantage of the prices that will yield a higher profit margin.

loans.use: to buy general hardware items.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladys tiene 39 años y hace más de 20 años que se dedica a la venta de pescados, cuando era chica acompañaba a su mama a hacer lo mismo y poco a poco se hizo de capital para ser una vendedora independiente.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, y  a tempranas hora del día ya está al costado del rio para vender los pescados, tiene una hija que trabaja en España y uno de sus sueños es que vuelva su hija al Paraguay y así poder montar un negocio de pescados fijos  para vender al por mayor.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de pescados para poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Gladys is 39 years old. For more than 20 years, she has earned a living selling fish. When she was a little girl she would accompany her mother, who also sold fish. Little by little she raised the capital to become an independent vendor. 

She is a very hard-working individual. In the early morning hours she is already at the riverside selling fish. She has a daughter who works in Spain and one of her dreams is for her daughter to return to Paraguay, so they can establish a fixed locale to sell fish wholesale. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase fish to be able to continue selling, and to continue working.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Tamemkoh Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Memunatu was born in Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone, 43 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has onr child who is attending secondary school. Memunatu sells slippers, cloths, glasses/plates, etc., and has been doing this business for nine years now.

With the help of this loan, Memunatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Memunatu will use her share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy cloths, glasses/plates, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cloths, glasses/plates, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Kissy Town Women Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Kissy Town Women” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Tidankay is the featured leader of this group. Tidankay is 38-year-old; she is married with two children. Tidankay sells palm oil and charcoal. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of palm oil and charcoal to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm oil and charcoal to add to her business.

loans.name: Jheny Alexandra

texts.es: Jheny es una joven emprendedora, que a sus 24 años de edad, ya tiene su propio negocio, un puesto de venta de comidas rápidas que inició como una alternativa para generar ingresos y apoyar a su madre con la economía del hogar, su madre, quien además de apoyarla en esta labor, fue quien le enseñó la actividad ya que por muchos años estuvo dedicada a esta labor, trabaja los fines de semana de 2:00 pm a 2:00 am, para aprovechar la ubicación que posee, pues está en una zona muy comercial, en un espacio rodeado de discotecas. Su empeño, esfuerzo y energía positiva la han llevado a lograr los objetivos que se propone, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar otro carro de comidas rápidas, una carpa grande, sillas y mesas y surtido al por mayor (panes, papas, carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas, entre otros), de esta manera podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo, ampliar su producción y ofrecer un servicio más ágil a sus clientes, quienes podrán consumir sus productos cómodamente, todo esto se reflejará en el incremento de las ventas y de los ingresos que genera con los que podrá seguir aportando a la economía de su hogar. Jheny sueña con poder fortalecer su negocio y, en un futuro poder arrendar un local en el que pueda realizar su labor, además podrá generar más oportunidades de empleo y tendrá la capacidad para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jheny, 24, is a young entrepreneur who already has a business of her own: a fast-food stand that she started as an alternative to earn income an help her mother with household expenses.  He mother who helps her with the business is also who taught it to her for she worked at this for many years.  She works weekends from 2pm until 2am to take advantage of the location she has which is a very commercial zone that’s surrounded by discotheques.  

Her effort, dedication and positive energy have led her to reach the goals she’s set and this is why she’s asking for a loan to buy another fast-food cart, a large tent, tables, chairs and supplies at wholesale (bread rolls, potatoes, cold-cuts, sauces, soft-drinks, etc.) to be able to improve her working conditions, expand production and offer quicker service to customers who will be able to enjoy what she makes comfortably.  All of this will be reflected in increased sales and income generated that she’ll be able to use to continue supporting household economy.

Jheny dreams with being able to strengthen her business and in future be able to rent a space in which to do her work as well as to generate employment opportunities.  She will also have the capacity to provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy another fast-food cart, a large tarp, tables, chairs and ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Gloria Catalina

texts.es: Gloria es una mujer emprendedora, a sus 31 años de edad genera sus ingresos trabajando en su propio negocio de venta de comidas, ubicado al lado de la carretera que pasa por la finca donde reside en un corregimiento muy conocido de la ciudad, allí trabaja sola todos los días, vende wafles, alimentos fritos, sándwiches derretidos, cafés, entre otros; la idea surgió de la necesidad de generar los recursos económicos para aportar a la economía de su hogar, pues se encontraba desempleada y las oportunidades de trabajo están muy limitadas en la ciudad. Su empuje, empeño y dedicación le han permitido salir adelante y ya lleva con su negocio 9 meses en funcionamiento, logrando que los clientes de la zona la reconozcan por los buenos productos que ofrece. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (aceite, verduras, salsas, mezcla para waffles, mantequilla, entre otros) y realizar adecuaciones al espacio donde está ubicada (poner piso para nivelar la mesa de trabajo y la freidora) adecuar una parte del espacio para abrir un parqueadero, esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pues tendrán la posibilidad  de parquear sus vehículos y poder disfrutar los productos en el sitio, además esto le dará mejor aspecto a la imagen del negocio, abriendo la posibilidad de atraer nuevos comensales, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de su labor.  Es así como Gloria desea seguir avanzando y en un futuro poder cumplir el sueño de abrir un restaurante en un local comercial, que le genere mayor rentabilidad y le garantice una estabilidad económica para disfrutar de mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is an enterprising woman.  At 31 years of age, she makes a living working her own business of selling food.  She is situated at the side of the highway that passes by the house where she lives in a well-known small town of the city.  There, she works alone every day, selling waffles, fried foods, melt sandwiches, coffees, and other things.  

The idea came out of the need to generate income to support household finances, since she was unemployed and job opportunities are very limited in the city.  Her drive, determination and dedication have allowed her to get ahead, and her business has already been running for 9 months, and her customers from the area recognize her for the good products she offers.

She is now applying for a loan in order to invest it in the purchase of wholesale supplies (oil, vegetables, sauces, waffle mix, butter, and other items), to upgrade the space where she is located (put in a floor to level the work table and the deep fryer), and to upgrade part of the space to open an parking lot.  

This will allow her to offer better service to her customers, because they will have the option to park their vehicles and enjoy the products on site.  Furthermore, this will improve the image of the business, opening the possibility of attracting new diners, which will allow her to increase her sales and the income she receives from her labor.

This is how Gloria wishes to continue getting ahead and in the future, realize her dream of opening a restaurant in a commercial location, that would be more profitable and guarantee economic stability to be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (oil, vegetables, sauces, waffle mix, butter, among others), to upgrade the space where she is located (put in a floor to level the work table and the deep fryer), and to upgrade part of the space to open a parking lot.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María esta casada con el Sr. Corpulo tienen  1 hija, ellos están trabajando arduamente por dar a su hija todo lo que necesita y que no tenga que pasar por privaciones.
Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y muy conocida en el barrio. Consiguió montar su despensa con un poco de dinero que le había juntado con el trabajo que realiza su marido. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, arroz, fideo, bebidas y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Maria is married to Mr. Corpulo. They have a daughter. They are working hard to give their daughter everything she needs so that she does not have to experience hardships. 

She has a well stocked grocery store that is well known in her neighbourhood. She managed to establish the store with the little money she put together from her husband's work. She is a very determined, honest, and well known individual who is loved by the residents of her neighborhood. 

She is requesting this loan to buy flour, rice, noodles, drinks and other items. This will allow her to continue working and to provide her customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, noodles, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Powerful Women Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Powerful Women” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Ramatu is the featured leader of this group. Ramatu is a 37-year-old, married with six children, five of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Ramatu sells clothes. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock to sell.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Elizabeth is married and has four children. Both she and her husband are farming their land and are currently growing maize. Elizabeth is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because her bees will pollinate her crops, increasing their yield and quality. 

This is Elizabeth's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to buy agricultural equipment. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to save up enough money to expand her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Carmen Daysi

texts.es: Carmen es una madre soltera de 42 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos a los cuales ha sacado adelante sola. Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes restaurantes, pero un día tomó la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio y, como no poseía el capital completo, se asoció con una prima y montaron un restaurante, pero con el paso del tiempo comenzaron a tener inconvenientes dañando tanto la relación laboral, como familiar, por lo que ella decidió retirarse de la sociedad. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando como empleada, pero con la motivación de sus dos hijos (ver foto) está decidida a iniciar un nuevo proyecto productivo, quiere poner un puesto de venta de arepas venezolanas en la esquina de su casa, para lo cual solicita el apoyo del crédito, con el que comprará utensilios de cocina, un carro de comidas rápidas y materia prima al por mayor (salsas, carnes, gaseosas, harina para arepas, huevos, aceite, papas, entre otros), así podrá poner en marcha su idea de negocio, del cual espera obtener buenos resultados, pues sueña con que la gente llegue, consuma sus productos y vuelva y, lograr ser reconocida en el sector, lo que le permitirá generar los recursos suficientes para dar a sus hijos un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida
texts.en:
Carmen, 42, is a single mother living with her two sons who she’s raised alone.  She’s worked in various restaurants in her productive life but one day decided to start her own business and since she did not have all the money needed to do so she partnered with a cousin and they opened a restaurant.  In time though they started having problems that damaged both the working relationship and also the family relationship which is why she decided to end the partnership.

She’s currently working as an employee but with her two son’s motivation (see photo) she’s decided to start a new productive activity.  She wants to open a Venezuelan ‘arepa’ stand [grilled, filled corn cakes] on her corner which is why she’s asking for financial support to buy kitchen utensils, a fast-food cart and raw materials at wholesale (sauces, meats, soft-drinks, arepa flour, eggs, oil and potatoes, among others) to launch her business from which she hopes to get good results for she dreams with people coming buy to consume her products and return again so she can become well-known in the sector and generate resources sufficient to give her sons better well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, a fast-food cart and ingredients.

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es: Luz, a sus 57 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y cabeza de hogar desde la separación con su esposo. Desde hace varios años se dedica a la confección directa y a realizar trabajos de sastrería, se dio a conocer por su excelente calidad en el trabajo y, gracias a ello, su clientela ha ido aumentando, lo que le ha permitido generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Es una mujer apasionada por su labor, muy ordenada y cumplida con los encargos de sus clientes, esto le ha permitido avanzar, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado, especialmente en la economía del hogar, debido a la gran competencia que tiene en el mercado, sin embargo ha sabido llevar la situación y ha surgido exitosamente. Solicita su tercer ciclo de crédito con el que desea comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, gujas, elásticos, cremalleras, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener la materia prima necesaria para cumplir con los encargos que tiene pendientes y así podrá cumplir de manera ágil con las entregas de las prendas, lo que le dará la posibilidad de aumentar sus contratos y así aumentar los ingresos con los cuales sostiene a sus hijos. Luz quiere seguir trabajando arduamente para así poder cumplir el sueño de aumentar su nivel de producción y generar oportunidades de empleo, lo que para ella significa tener una mejor calidad de vida, no sólo para ella y sus hijos, sino para las demás personas que influyan en su unidad productiva.
texts.en:
Luz, 57, is mother of two children and has been head of household since separating from her husband.  She’s been working manufacturing clothes and doing tailoring services for several years.  She became known for her excellent work and thanks to it her clientele has grown which has led to her generating sufficient income to cover her home’s basic needs and move her children forward.

She’s a woman who is passionate about her work; she’s very organized and delivers her customers’ orders on time.  This has allowed her to continue advancing despite various obstacles that have arisen, especially in the household economy, due to the large amount of competition she has in the marketplace.  Notwithstanding, she’s known how to overcome the situation and has come out on top.

She’s asking for her third loan to buy supplies at wholesale (fabric, thread, needles, elastic, zippers, etc.) which will make it possible for her to have raw materials needed to fill pending orders and efficiently meet delivery deadlines which will give her the opportunity of increasing her contracts and increase income she uses to support her children.

Luz wants to continue working hard to reach her dream of increasing production levels and to generate employment opportunities which for her will mean better quality of life not only for her and her children but also for others who participate in her productive unit.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
La Sra. Melissa es de la ciudad de Encarnación, esta acompañada, y aun no tiene la dicha de ser mama.
Ella es comerciante, y tiene una casa comercial. Actualmente, está cursando la carrera de laboratorio, y está en el 3er año. Su principal sueño es recibirse y ejercer su profesión en forma independiente.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que así podrá seguir estudiando y estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Melissa’s from the city of Encarnación.  She has a spouse but hasn’t yet had the joy of being a mother.  She’s a merchant and has a store.  She’s currently studying to be a lab technician and is in year three.  Her main dream is to graduate and to practice her profession independently.  She’s requesting this loan to pay tuition in order to continue with her studies and get closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, también cuenta que trabaja en un banco, es  la única que genera ingreso dentro de la Familia, sus metas o una de ellas es obtener un título de Universitaria.
De aquí a cierto tiempo se ve como toda una profesional, que pueda ayudar a las demás personas. Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y sueña con poder tener un negocio que poder administrar.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, como así también para el pago de sus gastos de manutención.
texts.en: Luz is from the city of Caaguazú.  She relates that she works in a bank and is the only wage-earner in her family.  One of her goals is to get a university degree.  She sees herself becoming a complete professional in a certain period of time that can help others.  She’s studying business administration and she dreams with owning a business she can manage.  She’s asking for this loan to pay tuition and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay tuition and living costs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive con sus padres y actualmente está en el 2° año de la carrera de derecho. Proviene de una familia humilde pero con el esfuerzo del día a día va superando los obstáculos y alcanzando sus metas.
Él quiere ser un gran abogado que pueda ayudar a las demás personas y así ser útil no solo a si mismo, sino también a los demás. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y así estar más cerca de su meta y cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en: Juan lives with his parents and is currently in second year of law school.  He comes from a humble family but with his daily effort is overcoming obstacles and reaching his goals.  He wants to become a great attorney that can help others and be useful not only to himself but to others too.  He’s grateful for the support he’s getting for it will be very useful.   He’s asking for this loan to pay tuition to get closer to his goal and make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es: José, a sus 52 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio desde hace aproximadamente 22 años, una ebanistería que inició luego de aprender al lado de su hermano el manejo  de la madera y, luego fue perfeccionando su técnica cuando entró a trabajar en una ebanistería de la ciudad, allí obtuvo la experiencia necesaria para luego independizarse. De esta manera genera los ingresos suficientes para sostener a su hijo adolescente y para llevar el sustento a su hogar. El cliente es un hombre pujante, activo y trabajador, ha sobrepasado diversos obstáculos durante su vida productiva, pero siempre motivado por su hijo, por el que siempre busca nuevas alternativas para sacarlo adelante. Actualmente solicita el apoyo de su octavo ciclo de crédito, con el que desea comprar insumos al por mayor (madera, inmunizador, pegantes, entre otros) esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y  podrá tener disponibilidad de insumos para cumplir con los encargos que tiene pendientes, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y de los ingresos que recibe por su trabajo. José manifiesta que hasta el momento se encuentra muy bien en todo sentido y lo único que desea es ver a su hijo salir adelante, brindarle una excelente educación y velar para que sea un hombre de bien, ese sería su mayor deseo.
texts.en:
José, who is 52 years old, has had his own business for approximately 22 years: a carpentry shop that he set up after learning how to work wood with his brother. He continued honing his skills by working for a carpentry shop in the city, where he gained the experience he needed to become independent. This is how he generates enough income to support his teenage son and provide for his family. 

This client is a driven, active, and hardworking man who has overcome several hurdles in his life. His son has always been his motivation, and he is always looking for new alternatives in order to provide for him. 

He is currently requesting the help of an eighth lending cycle, which he wants to use to buy wholesale supplies (wood, sealer, glue, and other items). This will allow him to keep working and he will have supplies available to fulfill pending orders. This will result in an increase in sales and in the income he earns from his work. José says he is doing very well so far in all respects and the only thing he wants is to see his son get ahead. He wants to give him an excellent education and ensure he becomes an upstanding man. That is his greatest wish.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (wood, sealer, glue, and other items).

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Amistad está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comités, donde todas y cada una de ellas está trabajando con la mayor de sus fuerzas para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nilsa quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de vida, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total. Ella cuenta que hace la venta de forma ambulante, y es por eso que pide de este crédito, para poder comprar prendas, y calzados y así seguir con sus ventas.
Ellas están muy contentas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group called ‘Amistad’ (Friendship) is in cycle #2 in the committee program.   Each and every one of them is working with the maximum effort to be able to give their families everything they were unable to have themselves.

One of the members is Nilsa who by means of her effort and non-stop work and by applying successful women’s behaviors is improving her life situation.  She knows, however, that the work and effort she’s exerting must be continuous and permanent in order to reach total success.   She relates that she’s a street vendor and this is why she’s asking for the loan to be able to buy clothes and shoes to continue with her sales.

They are very happy for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kely Johana

texts.es: Kely es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, madre soltera de una hija de 3 años por la que trabaja incansablemente. Hace algún tiempo comenzó a generar ingresos por cuenta propia, inicialmente vendía ropa que compraba en la ciudad al por mayor y retornaba a su pueblo para venderla, pero debido a los costos que esto implicaba, ella decidió cambiar de productos y comenzó a vender mercancía y artículos de catálogos, aprovechando que con estos se beneficia de unos programas de incentivos por ventas, lo que le genera ingresos adicionales para llevar el sustento a su hogar y velar por el bienestar de su pequeña hija. Actualmente alterna sus ventas con un empleo en oficios varios, pues debe generar más ingresos por ser cabeza de hogar. Su tenacidad, positivismo y esas ganas interminables de salir adelante la motivan para buscar nuevas alternativas que la impulsen para cumplir sus objetivos, es por ello que solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará mercancía al por mayor (ropa interior y exterior, accesorios, cosméticos, cremas corporales, entre otros), así podrá tener más variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y el margen de ganancias, especialmente en la temporada navideña que se aproxima, en la que sus ventas tienden a aumentar. De esta manera Kely podrá seguir avanzando y luchando para que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de montar su propio almacén en un local comercial, que le permita prestar un mejor servicio a su clientela y que le genere mayores ingresos económicos para brindar a su hija un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Kely, 20, is an enterprising young woman.  She’s a single mother of a three-year-old daughter she works tirelessly for.  Some time ago she started earning her own income.  At first, she sold clothes she’d buy at wholesale in the city that she’d come back to her town to sell but due to costs this implied she decided to change products and started selling merchandise and products via catalog taking advantage of benefits available from sales incentives they offer which generate additional income to provide household sustenance and well-being for her little girl.

She currently alternates her sales with various jobs for she must generate more income as head of household.  Her tenacity, positive attitude and unending drive to get ahead motivate her to seek new alternatives that will impel her to reach her goals.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale (underwear and outerwear, accessories, cosmetics, body creams, etc.) to have more variety on-hand to meet customer needs which will lead to higher sales and profits especially during the approaching Christmas season when sales tend to increase.

In this way, Kely will continue advancing and striving so that in future she can open her own store in a commercial site so she can offer better customer service and generate higher income to provide better well-being and quality of life for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es: Ángela, a sus 26 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos de 8 y 4 años. Actualmente se encuentra desempleada, por lo que quiere iniciar su propio negocio para generar ingresos que le permitan apoyar a su esposo con la economía del hogar. Quiere comenzar con la cría y comercialización de cerdos, pues tiene el espacio disponible en una pequeña finca que sus padres le dejaron como herencia y aprovechara que posee conocimientos en la labor gracias a su familia que toda la vida se ha dedicado a las labores agropecuarias. Su perseverancia, empeño y las ganas de salir adelante, la motivan para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que construirá los chiqueros y comprará lechones para cría y engorde, de esta manera podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera obtener buenos resultados, especialmente en la temporada de fin de navidad que se aproxima, en el que aumenta el consumo de esta carne, lo que para ella significa generar más ingresos económicos. Ángela desea luchar arduamente para sacar su proyecto adelante y en un futuro sueña tener una finca muy productiva, con diversidad de productos para ofrecer al mercado y poder garantizar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida para sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela, 26, is married and mother of two children aged 8 and 4.  She’s currently unemployed which is why she wants to start her own business to earn income that she can help her husband meet household expenses with.  She wants to start raising and selling pigs for she has space available in her small farm her parents left her as an inheritance and she will take advantage of the skills she has since her family has spent their entire lives in animal husbandry activities.

Her perseverance, effort and drive to get ahead motivate her to request the loan to build pigsties and to buy piglets to raise and fatten up to start her productive project this way that she hopes to get good results from especially in the approaching Christmas and end-of-year season that’s approaching in which consumption of pork increases and this means an increase in her income.

Ángela wants to work hard to move her project ahead and in future have a very productive farm with a diversity of products to take to market and to be able to ensure better well-being and quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to build pigsties and buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Kue

texts.en:
Kue was born and raised in a Hmong village in Payao, a province in northern Thailand.  In her youth, she and her family moved from region to region seeking “greener hills” and less crowded lands for farming.  She was a pioneer in the original group of Hmong who journeyed to Phrae Province and settled the Huay Hom Village.  From a small settlement, the village has now become home to hundreds of Hmong. 

Kue’s son has risen to a place of prominence in the community - he is a village headman.
