The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Hawa, who is sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 25,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Vardishagh

texts.en:
Vardishagh is a farmer from the Masis village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband works in the private sector with a very low salary that does not cover the expenses of the family. For more than 15 years the family has been extensively engaged in agribusiness. 

With the help of her family members, Vardishagh is engaged in livestock, including cows and hens, and in the cultivation of beans, tomatoes, eggplant, pepper, alfalfa and several fruits (peach, apricot, fig, apple, pear and walnut). Her sons help her sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

As the family's needs are growing day by day, Vardishagh wants to increase the number of livestock to effectively meet her family's needs. A loan of USD 2,500 will be a great support, enabling her to purchase two steers and some forage for the livestock. 

As this is Vardishagh’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Vardishagh and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase two steers and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon is the married mother of two children, living in the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Speu province.  

She does rice-planting while her husband is a palm juice maker. With 30 years' experience in this business, she is able to earn up to USD 3 per day and keep USD 1.5 each day as savings.

Samon has joined VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, this cycle as a first-time borrower. She is now applying for a loan to pay her son’s university tuition. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also help relieve the financial burden for her family.  Thereby she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay her son’s university tuition

location.town: Kompong Speu province, Phnom Srouch district

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan is a 57-year-old married man and he has 3 children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Agdash IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He learned to operate a small business from his parents. Through a lot of sacrifice, he has become one of the leaders in agriculture for the area in which he lives. He continued working in the same business after he was married. With the income from the business, he was able to raise cattle successfully. Aslan also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.

His monthly income is about 120 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income for his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday meals. Aslan applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase 2 cattle, one milking cow and fodder. This will be his 1st loan. He hopes that Kiva will help him.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cattle, one milking cow and fodder.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 61 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioners, laundry soap, cream, cereals, etc. 

She has borrowed and paid off 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from retailing electronic mobile load. Alfreda wants to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioners, laundry soap, cream, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 42 years old and married to John, a 42-year-old man. Their marriage is blessed with three children, namely: Silvester, 16, 1st grade of a vocational high school; Paulina, 15, 3rd grade of a junior high school; and Maria, 6, early childhood education.

Ester has been running a kiosk business since 2008. She sells soap, detergents, snacks, soft drinks, cakes, instant noodles, gasoline, mobile phone credit cards, and sometimes Nasi Kuning (a package of yellow rice with omelet, noodles, and chili), too. 

In order to increase the income of her business she has applied an individual loan from TLM in amount of IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on more stocks, such as snacks, soft drinks, instant noodles, cigarettes, and mobile phone credit cards, and on electrical installation for her kiosk.  

She hopes that the business will run well so it will enable her to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to buy stocks such as snacks, soft drink, instant noodles, cigarette, and mobile phone credit cards and pay for electrical installation

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an egg vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and also earns an income from running a general store. Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Arlene is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa was born in 1979. She is married and a mother of 3. Her husband works in agriculture. As her husband’s siblings are young and their parents passed away, Sanaa is also responsible for them, and is considering them as her own children. 

She has been selling blankets and clothes for a year. She started her project selling a small quantity of them, and she found it profitable and a good support for her family. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes and blankets to raise her productivity and income, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, Sanaa applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of blankets and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 19 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his five siblings and his parents. Ahmad is studying for a diploma in Mechanical Engineering, first year.  He also works as a mechanic. He is planning to continue his studies until he gets his Bachelor Degree to be able to find a better job after graduation, and to start earning a better income to help his family financially. Mohammad doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is 19 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her brother and her parents. Anwar is studying nutrition technology and is in her second year of a university program. 

Anwar is requesting a loan to pay her upcoming semester fees. She is planning to continue her studies and work in her field after graduation to start helping her family as they are currently facing a financial crisis.

loans.use: to pay upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Ebrahim Group

texts.en:
Ebrahim Group consists of three women and a man, all of whom live in Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 120,000 YER to pay for carpentry. 

Mariam, who is 35 years old and lives with her family in Taiz, is the leader of the group. She has a small house and has been accumulating money for a few years in order to build two extra rooms. To complete construction, she has requested a loan of 30,000 YER to buy additional building materials.

Mariam hopes to open a savings account for her family members after finishing house construction.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her house

loans.name: Tazagul

texts.en:
Tazagul is 42 years old and married with two children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Agdash IDP Settlement.  She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than eight years. She is very hardworking and passionate about her work. She considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers, and to plant fruit trees with her husband. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make a profit in order to support her family. Her monthly income from this business is about 130 AZN.

In order to improve the living conditions of her family, Tezegul plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes that in the near future her sons will help her to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, she wants the business to continue and prosper. She has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 700 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 32 years old and the father of two children.  He has been working as a plumber since he was 19 years old. Ahmad is a multi-tasking person who works hard to manage several businesses at a time to make sure that he is capable of covering his family's needs.

In addition to his work as a plumber, Ahmad started a new business in March 2013 that has to do with entertaining people, to increase his family's income. He opened a entertainment shop where he provides people with services such as Play Station, billiards, and Babyfoot.

Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to start a lingerie-selling business.  He plans to ask his wife to run it at home, in a way that she'll fill free time with something productive and at the same time take care of her family.

loans.use: To  start a new business selling lingerie

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 36 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Francoise runs a food market where she sells various retail items. 

Francoise is requesting a loan to buy more liters of cooking oil and maize flour to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Adila Group

texts.en:
Mayla is 33 and married with two children. She has a house and has started to build a room for herself and her husband. She is a member of the loan group, Adila, which consists of three ladies and a man who all live in Taiz, Yemen.

Mayla is requesting a loan to remodel her house and will use her portion of the loan to buy building materials such as cement and lumber. She is grateful for her loan and commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy cement and lumber

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La señora Felipa es una señora de 53 años de edad, se dedica a la preparación envasado y venta al por menor de papas fritas las cuales son entregadas a vendedoras de mercados populares de la ciudad donde vive;  la señora Felipa está casada, el esposo ya es de avanzada edad el cual recibe un ingreso por jubilación pero no le alcanza dicho ingreso por los elevados costos de los medicamentos que él toma, no tiene hijos dependientes de ellos, dado que ya todos están casados o en otro departamento y se olvidaron de ellos, la señora Felipa  es una señora con ganas de superación y con mucho amor hacia su esposo esto es demostrado por el gran sacrificio que hace para poder comprar los medicamentos, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar más insumos y hace poder generar más ingresos para el bien de ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Felipa is a 53-year-old-woman. She makes her living packaging and retailing french fries which are sold to vendors in popular markets in the city where she lives. Felipa is married, her husband is already advanced in age so he receives retirement income, but such income is not enough for the high cost of medications he takes. She does not have children who are dependent on them, given that they are all already married or in another apartment and they forgot about their parents.

Felipa is a woman with motivation to get ahead and with much love towards her husband. This is demonstrated by the great sacrifice that she makes to be able to buy the medicine. The purpose of the current loan is to be able to buy more supplies and to be able able to generate more income for the good of she and her husband.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to make french fries.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel est un homme de 37 ans marié, père de 4 enfants dont l'age varien entre 4 et 13 ans. Après sa formation, il ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'il gère depuis 3 ans déjà. il a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques,mèches et petit matériel dans son institut parce qu'il achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. il sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de ses enfants, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en: Daniel is a 37-year-old man who is a married father of four children, from 4 to 13 years old. After finishing his training, he opened a hair salon, which he has been running for three years already. He often has a problem with a lack of cosmetic products, hair extensions, and sundry supplies in his salon, since he purchases his products retail. With a goal of satisfying his customers and making a bigger profit, he is requesting a loan to be able to purchase his supplies in large quantities enabling him to achieve his objectives. The profits earned from this loan will  help him to meet his needs and those of his children, as well as to save money to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to increase his stock of hair extensions, weaves, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
This is Abner. He previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit, and also to buy some equipment for the repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. Abner hopes to have another unit of tricycle and dreams that his children will finish their studies.

He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. He attends the weekly fellowship* meetings that allow him to know more of God’s word. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar).

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 22 years old and has no children. Mouhammad has a grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a house such as snacks, drinks, dairy products, and detergent. He has been a grocer since 2009 and has gained much experience in his field. Mouhammad is very well known in the surrounding areas and has an excellent reputation.

Mouhammad is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan to pay the annual rent on his grocery store and buy more goods to sell. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his grocery store and buy more good to sell

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 23-year-old married youth client. He is from Iraq, has a single child and is the sole provider for his family. He is a barber and owns a barber shop. He has been in this field since 2008 and has gained much experience in this field through years of practice. He now has a hired employee and is becoming well-known in the surrounding area and has gained an excellent reputation.

Malek is applying for a youth loan of 3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to renovate his barber shop in order to attract more customers, improve the quality of his services and thus increase his profits.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from the Armash village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, her three-year-old daughter, her parents-in-law and her brother-in-law. Anna's husband and brother-in-law work in the private sector. The family is engaged in the cultivation of tomatoes and several fruits (peach, apricot and apple). They sell the agricultural products in the local market. Farming is an important source of income for the family. 

To be able to continue their agribusiness in a sustainable way, there is a need to make some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 will assist Anna in reaching her goal, enabling her to purchase fertilizers, tomato seeds, fuel for the agricultural machinery, and to pay for harvesting services. Anna and her big family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their good will and support in helping them collect the needed loan and sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, tomato seeds, fuel for the agricultural machinery, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Ameeneh

texts.en: Ameeneh is 21 years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with her 6 siblings and her parents. One of her sisters is working at a governmental entity. Ameeneh is studying in her 2nd year for a Bachelor of Teaching degree. She is planning to continue her study to work in her field after graduation to start helping her family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Otilda

texts.en: Otilda is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has two children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as slippers, noodles, cigarettes, eggs, books, pencils, salt, water and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, noodles, cigarettes, eggs, books, pencils, salt, water and biscuits.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio de 35 años, estudio hasta 6° grado,  es casado,  junto a su esposa tienen un negocio de comida típica (pupusas y pasteles), es padre de 4 hijos y todos viven con él. 

El negocio de la venta de pupusas, pasteles etc., fue por iniciativa propia que comenzó con el negocio, está ubicado a 100 metros  de la casa donde él vive con su familia, camina hasta su negocio todos los días y su esposa le ayuda y el horario de atención a los clientes es de 7:00 de la mañana a 5:00 de la tarde

Con el crédito pretende comprar una hilera, maíz y una refrigeradora, para así poder guardar los ingredientes para las pupusas y los pasteles y otros productos perecederos, que necesitan refrigeración, así como también bebidas.

A futuro  planea que con las necesidades cubiertas con dicho crédito, mejore su negocio y obtener más y mejores ganancias para seguir dándoles el estudios a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Lucio, age 35, studied through the sixth grade.  He is married, and together with his wife he has a traditional food business (pupusas and cakes).  He is the father of four children; all the children live with him.

It was through his own initiative that the business selling pupusas, cakes, etc., began.  It is located 100 meters from the house where he lives with his family.  He walks to his business every day.  His spouse helps him.  The hours they are open to customers are from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.

With the loan, he plans to buy a cooler, corn, and a refrigerator so that he can keep the ingredients for the pupusas, cakes, and other perishable products that need refrigeration, such as drinks.

In the future, he plans that with his needs covered by this loan, he will improve his business and get better earnings so that his children can continue to study to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, corn, and a refrigerator, so that he can keep the ingredients for the pupusas, cakes, and other perishable products.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of selling used clothing and curtains in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years now.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing and curtains to sell. Apolinaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es: José es un señor de 49 años de edad, originario de Teustepe, casado y padre ejemplar de 9 hijos. Es de oficio Agricultor, dedicado al cultivo de Maíz, frijol y trigo. Inicio en este negocio hace 25 años con capital propio, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener a sus hijos, los cuales lo apoyan en este duro y pesado trabajo. Su meta próxima es darle mantenimiento a su terreno y cosechas. Solicita el préstamo para comprar: abonos y  semillas para cultivar, con el fin de aumentar su producción y tener una mejor calidad de productos. Estima que el crédito le ayudara aumentar sus ingresos y lograr un mantenimiento constante a sus cultivos. Su plan futuro es sembrar aún más semillas y ofrecer maíz, frijoles, trigo de calidad.
texts.en:
José is a 49 year-old man from Teustepe.  He is married and an exemplary father to 9 children.  He is a farmer, working in the cultivation of corn, beans, and wheat.  He began this work 25 years ago using his own capital.  With great effort he has managed to provide for his children, who help him in this heavy and difficult work.  

His next objective is to do maintenance on his land and his crops.  He is asking for this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to plant, with the goal of increasing his production and having a higher quality product.  He thinks that the loan will help him to increase his income and manage a constant level of maintenance for his crops.  His future plan is to sew even more seeds and offer quality corn, beans, and wheat.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and seeds to grow

loans.name: Sreypich

texts.en:
Sreypich is 19 years old and a single woman living with her parents in Kandal province. She graduated from high school in 2011 and she continued studying at a college in Phnom Penh. She is a second-year student, majoring in English literacy. She has a passion for her major because she is aware that this major is suitable for her personality. Her education was subsidized by her parents. Her mother is a Krama (a sturdy traditional Cambodian garment weaver) and her father is a farmer.

Due to the family’s financial constraints, Sreypich decided to acquire a loan from HKL, a reliable MFI that provides a suitable loan term and interest charge. She will use 430 US dollars of the loan to pay the third year education fees of her program. She will use the other portion of the loan to buy materials needed to support her course. 

Sreypich is committed to studying hard with the loan funded, because she realizes that an education will give her the opportunity to get a high-paying job that will allow her to support her parents when they are getting older. She is pictured with her mother, who will be responsible for making principal repayments on the loan. Sreypich appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to programs like Kiva via its partner, HKL, which have supported education for her individually as well as for other students.

loans.use: to pay the third-year education fees of her program and buy materials needed to support her course.

loans.name: Sobeida  De Rocio

texts.es: Sobeida es una señora muy trabajadora de 45 años,  vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, ciudad de Ecuador, zona cálida húmeda, ciudad muy comercial por ser unión de la sierra y de la costa. Zona donde también se producen el plátano y cacao, sector muy productivo por su clima. Sobeida, es madre soltera, desde joven tuvo que ver la manera de salir adelante sola con su hijo. Comenzó vendiendo confitería ambulante para darle la educación, y aunque fue muy duro estar expuesta al peligro de las calles, ella fue ahorrando y poco a poco se pudo poner su tienda, ahora ya tiene 12 años en el negocio al cual le dedica todo el día. Con los ingresos hizo su casita, donde vive actualmente sola ya que su hijo es mayor de edad y ya tiene su familia. Conoció a Fundación Alternativa por muy buenas referencias de clientes que han sido beneficiados, ahora le han dado la oportunidad de salir adelante con un crédito el mismo que lo invertirá en arroz, aceite, azúcar y demás víveres, que incrementen el surtido de su tienda y por lo tanto sus ganancias; también con parte del dinero va a mejorar su casita ya que le faltan varios arreglos. Se siente muy agradecida con Fundación y Kiva  porque es el primer crédito que ha recibido en su vida. Con esta ayuda mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sobeida is a very hardworking, 45-year-old woman living in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a city in Ecuador with a hot, humid climate.  It’s a very commercial city because it’s a crossroads between the coast and the mountains.  It’s also a banana and cocoa bean producing zone that’s very productive thanks to its climate.

Sobeida’s a single mother.  Since she was young she had to find a way to raise her son alone.  She started out as a street vendor selling sweets in order to provide him with an education and although it was very hard being exposed to danger in the streets, she was able to save gradually until she was able to open her store.  She now has 12 years’ experience in the business she spends the entire day in.  She used her income to build her little house where she currently lives alone for her son is an adult now with a family of his own.  

She heard about Fundación Alternativa by means of very good references from clients that have benefited from it and now she’s had the opportunity of getting ahead with a loan that she’ll use to buy rice, oil, sugar and other food items to increase stock in her store and as a result increase her profits too.  She will also use part of the money to make some home repairs since her house is lacking a few improvements.  

She’s very grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva because this is the first loan she’s gotten her entire life.  It will help improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Eva Sandrit

texts.es: Eva es una joven campesina de 23 años de edad, nacida en el seno de una familia humilde que siempre se dedicó a las actividades del campo y, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, hoy en día ella se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, actividad con la que genera ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para brindar sustento a sus dos pequeños hijos de 8 y 1 años de edad. Su espíritu de superación, la tenacidad y la fortaleza con la que se levanta día a día, la impulsan para buscar nuevas opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar lechones y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa con la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para continuar solventando algunas necesidades familiares y, seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, que se ha convertido en la principal fuente de recursos económicos para la familia. Eva desea seguir luchando con empeño, dedicación y esfuerzo, para llegar a cumplir el sueño de adquirir más cerdos y tener una producción escalonada, que le garantice la entrada de utilidades constantemente y pueda brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Eva, 23, is a young farmer who was born into a humble family that’s always worked in the fields.  Thanks to her parents’ teaching she raises and sells pigs now, an activity that generates income she can use to help her husband cover household expenses and support her two children who are 8 and 1 years old.

Her spirit of self-improvement, tenacity and strength she awakens with every day push her to seek new options that will lead to success.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed concentrate to feed them to increase production and meet demand that increases in the upcoming Christmas season.  The result will be higher income to continue meeting family needs and reinvesting in her business that’s become the family’s main source of income.

Eva would like to continue striving with effort, dedication and determination to reach her dream of owning more pigs and to stagger production so that profits will be produced continuously so she can provide her children with better education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar,Diana no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Diana trabaja brindando atención al publico en un grifo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Diana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea cercar la parte delantera de su hogar con materiales adecuados y resistentes, así pues Diana seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Diana is a 22-year-old single woman who lives in the city of Ica in the Parcona district.  She lives with her parents and siblings.  She is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and has a great desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and having to work, she hasn't been able to study professionally.

Through her own efforts, Diana works serving the public at a local gas station.  She works every day for about 10 hours and she thinks that it is going well for her due to her dedication and effort.

Diana is very grateful for Kiva loans, since thanks to the help that is offered she will be able to improve her house.  She wants to put up walls in the front part of her house with good, durable materials.  In this way, Diana will keep working and striving so as to achieve her great dream of going to school to get a professional job.

loans.use: improve her house.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.ru: Абдучаббор холостой молодой человек в возрасте 22 лет. Он из Истаравшана. Абдучаббор около 5 лет работает водителем маршрутного такси. Он работает на маршруте город Истаравшан - город Худжанд. Выгоду, которую он получает от своей работы уходит на семью и ремонт автомобиля. Он живет с младшей сестрой и мамой. Несколько лет назад он потерял отца. Поэтому он сам поднимает свою семью. С помощью своей машины он зарабатывает. Из-за того что машина является старой, она нуждается в ремонте все чаще. Абдучаббор хочет купить новую машину, но денег на покупку ему не хватает. Он просит кредит, чтобы приобрести машину и продолжить свою работу на новом автомобиле.
texts.en: Abdujabbor is a young single 22 year old man. He is from Istaravshan. Abdujabbor has been working his taxi route for about five years. He works along the route from the city of Istarvshan to the city of Khujand. The returns he makes will go towards his family and automobile repairs. He lives with his younger sister and mother. Not long ago, he lost his father. Because of this he raises his family. With the help of his car he can earn income. Due to the fact that his car is old, it requires repairs more often. Abdujabbor wants to buy a new car, but he doesn't have enough money. He is asking for a loan to buy a car and continue his work with his new automobile.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz, a sus 46 años de edad, se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos desde que era joven, la actividad la aprendió de su familia, quien toda la vida se dedicó a las labores del campo. Su negocio inició con una cerda que estaba embarazada y, luego de tener sus crías, ella las alimentó durante un tiempo y luego vendió los lechones a vecinos del sector, fue así como poco a poco fue adquiriendo su capital de trabajo y ha logrado aportar a la economía de su familia, conformada por sus 3 hijos y su pareja sentimental. La cliente es una mujer pujante y dedicada a su labor, características por las que ha sido reconocida en la zona donde reside. Se motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará más lechones para cría y el concentrado para alimentar los animales; esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y aumentar su producción para satisfacer la demanda creciente de la temporada de fin de año, en la que el consumo de este tipo de carne se incrementa notablemente, mejorando el margen de ganancia que recibe por cada venta. De esta forma, Luz desea continuar con su labor, aumentar su capital de trabajo adquiriendo más lechones y hacer de su actividad un negocio rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, que le permita tener la capacidad para dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y disfrutar al lado de su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz, 46, has been raising and selling pigs since she was young, an activity she learned from her parents who have worked in the fields their entire lives.  Her business started with one pregnant sow and after the piglets were born Luz fed them for a time and then sold them to nearby neighbors.  This was how she gradually acquired working capital and contribute to family economy.  Her family consists of her three children and her spouse.

She’s a very driven woman who is dedicated to her work which has made her very well-known in the community she lives in.  She’s motivated to request the loan’s support to buy more piglets to raise and feed concentrate to feed them.  This will make it possible for her to continue with her work and increase production to meet the expected increased demand at the end of the year season when pork consumption rises considerably.

This will improve her profit margin on each sale and Luz will be able to continue with her work purchasing more piglets and increasing her working capital to make her business still more profitable so she can enjoy better quality of life alongside her husband.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Tanriverdi

texts.en:
Tanriverdi is 60 years old. He is a father of four children. He is a grandfather, too. 

He is a popular merchant in his city because he has been selling household goods for 35 years. He said that he started this business with money that he had earned from previous jobs. Month by month, he is growing his business with this hard-earned money. This activity generates sufficient income and there is strong demand for his goods since he has a lot of customers every day. 

In order to satisfy customer demand and expand his business, Tanriverdi needs a loan of AZN 1,500. This will let him continue with his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying new household goods.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: Martha, es madre de dos hijos de 3 y 13 años de edad y cabeza de hogar desde el día que su esposo la abandonó. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa de apuestas como vendedora y, para complementar los ingresos, alterna su empleo con la venta de mercancía por catálogo, actividad que realiza de manera independiente y empírica. Cuenta con la ventaja de que en su empleo está en contacto con gran número de personas, que pueden convertirse en clientes potenciales de los productos que ofrece; de esta manera ha generado los recursos necesarios para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, quienes son su principal motivación para levantarse y seguir luchando día a día. La cliente se caracteriza por ser una mujer tolerante, paciente y perseverante, siempre está en constante búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades para progresar. Esto la lleva a solicitar el apoyo de su primer ciclo de crédito con el que desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (accesorios, cosméticos, lencería, ropa, perfumería, entre otros); así podrá aprovechar los descuentos y las promociones que obtiene, reduciendo los costos y generando un incremento en el margen de utilidades que recibe por cada una de ellas. Es así como Martha desea continuar con su labor y, e un futuro quiere montar su propio almacén de variedades ubicado en un local comercial, que sea rentable y le garantice una estabilidad económica para brindar a sus hijos una buena educación y mejores condiciones de vida para disfrutar en la unión familiar.
texts.en:
Martha is mother of two children who are 3 and 13 years of age.  She’s been head of household since the day her husband abandoned her.  She currently works for a casino as a saleswoman and to add to her income works selling merchandise via catalog, an activity she’s taught herself to do and that she does independently.

She relates that her advantage is that she comes into contact with a large number of people at work that can become potential consumers of the products she sells.  She’s generated income this way to support her two children who are her main reason to get up in the morning and continue to struggle every day.

She’s noted for being a very tolerant, patient and persevering woman who is always looking for new opportunities of progress.  This brings her to seek support from her first loan cycle that she’ll use to buy merchandise at wholesale (accessories, cosmetics, lingerie, clothes, perfumery and others) to take advantage of discounts and promotions she can get reducing costs and increasing profit margin on each sale.

This is how Martha wants to continue working and in future open her own variety store in a commercial site that’s profitable and will ensure her economic stability to provide her children with a good education and better living conditions to enjoy together as a family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Indell 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  INDELL 8 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 1er prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Diaratou  debout en deuxième  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Indell 8 group are all married women with an average age of 40 years and an average of 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of Mali. Bandiagara is a 90% hilly area, where the women carry on their principal business of cultivating onions and producing shallots and other byproducts.

The women transport arable soil into the hills in order to craft crop beds for their farming businesses. They have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their vegetable businesses during this end of the rainy season. They are on their first loan with the organization.

Diaratou, pictured standing second from left to right in the photo, is primarily in the onion business. With her loan, she plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She sells her crops in the village and in Bandiagara after her harvest, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn a profit of 20,000 francs CFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses (their children's education, health, and food) as well as purchasing small livestock and poultry and reinvesting the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Philippe Prosper

texts.fr: Philippe est un homme camerounais de 39 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. elle gère une boutique de vente de cercueil et des articles décoratifs dans un quartier de la ville depuis 5 ans. il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant tissus de cercueil en gros afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître ses ventes et profits. les bénéfices générés vont être injectés dans dans son capital et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Philippe is a Cameroonian man, 39 years old, married and the father of two children. He has operated a shop selling caskets and decorations in a neighborhood of his town for 5 years. He is requesting this loan to be able to increase his stock of raw materials by purchasing casket fabrics in bulk in order to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and profits. The profits that he earns will be used as business capital and will help provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a young farmer from Norashen of Ararat village. He lives with his parents and his elderly grandmother. 

With the help if his parents, Davit is engaged in agriculture and in cultivation of tomatoes, peaches, apricots, and grapes. Farming is the main source of the family's income. Davit sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

To sustain his agribusiness, Davit needs a loan of USD 3,000 to pay for the harvesting services and the workforce and to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery. 

Since this is Davit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Davit and his family will be very thankful to the lenders for the goodwill and support in obtaining the needed loan and in helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting services and the workforce and to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Oliver Armando

texts.es: Oliver es un campesino de 25 años de edad, nacido en el seno de una familia campesina y humilde que durante toda la vida se dedicaron a las labores del campo; gracias a ello, hoy en día se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos, los cuales compra desde pequeños, los alimenta y luego los vende en pie o por kilos, según el requerimiento de sus clientes; de esta actividad provienen los ingresos con los que lleva el sustento diario a su familia. Su pujanza, tenacidad, perseverancia y empuje son características que lo impulsan para lograr los objetivos que se propone, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito, pues con el dinero desea comprar más lechones para cría y engorde, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta con la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, época en la que se incrementa el consumo de este tipo de carne; dando como resultado una mejoría notable en el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. De esta manera Oliver podrá seguir avanzando y progresar al lado de su esposa, y, en un futuro tendrá la posibilidad de acreditar su negocio y disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Oliver, 25, works in agriculture.  He was born into a humble family of farmers that spent their entire lives working in the fields.  Thanks to this, today he works raising pigs that he buys when they are little, feeds them and then sells them either live or by the kilo according to his customers’ requirements.  This is how he earns income for his family’s daily support.

His drive, tenacity, perseverance and dedication are characteristics that impel him to reach the goals he sets for himself.  This is why he’s asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and fatten up which will lead to increased production to meet demand that rises during the Christmas season that’s approaching when pork consumption increases.  

This will produce a significant increase in the profits he earns from his work and Oliver will be able to continue making progress and moving forward alongside his wife and in the future have the possibility of making his business well-known to enjoy better living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Melibel

texts.es:
Melibel es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y su pequeño hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Melibel no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Melibel trabaja como vendedora en una empresa aseguradora de su ciudad,ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Melibel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea ponerle piso de concreto a la habitación de su hijo, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Melibel, 21, lives with her parents and little boy in the city of Pucallpa.  She’s a hardworking single mother who focuses all her efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and the need to work, Melibel was unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, Melibel works as an saleswoman for an insurance company in her city.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Melibel’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will make home improvements because she wants to install a cement floor in her son’s bedroom.  She will continue working and striving to reach her great dream of providing her son with a good education.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is 54 years old and lives with her husband in the Mount of Olives, East Jerusalem.  They have adult children, the youngest of whom is 21.  Her husband is unemployed, but receives a disability allowance of just over US$1,000 per month.  Maha is a skilled seamstress, making traditional clothing for weddings, and she also sells handicrafts, embroidery and woodwork to sustain a part of the Palestinian tradition.  She works with her two daughters and seeks to expand her market by participating in bazaars – she has a local market but wishes to reach a wider group.  She has received business training from MATI, a business development foundation in Jerusalem, and is now keen to purchase a better sewing machine to improve the quality and efficiency of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Indell 9 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  INDELL 9 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 1er prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Noukiton   debout en 2eme  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 24.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Indell 9 group are married women. On average, they are 36 years old and have three children. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of Mali. 

Ninety percent of the locality of Bandiagara is made up of cliffs, where the women cultivate onions and shallots and their by-products. The women transport topsoil up the cliff to create vegetable beds for their agricultural work. 

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their gardening activities at the end of the rainy season. This is their first loan with the institution.

Noukiton, pictured standing second from the left, grows mainly onions. 

With her loan, she intends to buy seed and fertilizer. After harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Bandiagara to both men and women customers. 

Noukiton is hoping to make 24 000 CFA francs by the end of the campaign. This revenue will enable her to help her husband with the family expenses (schooling for the children, healthcare and food), buy small ruminants and poultry and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Bahati  est une conseillère du collectif de crédit  « Hodari», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 31 ans  et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est sans emploi, toute, il réalise  parfois de petites commissions sur la vente de parcelles. La cliente est une vendeuse de friperie.  Elle installe  ses articles à un point de vente animé et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 7 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 ballon de friperie.  Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une parcelle.  La vente en crédit et les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bahati is an adviser in the Hodari loan group. A young, experienced and dynamic entrepreneur, she is 31 years old and has five children, who are all in school. Her husband is unemployed, although he occasionally makes commission on the sale of plots of land. 

Bahati sells second-hand clothes. She sells her goods at a busy location and occasionally from home. She began her business with a loan from the Hekima microfinance institution and has been running this business for seven years.

This new loan will help her buy one bale of clothing.  In this way, she hopes to send her children to school, expand her trading business and buy a plot of land. 

Sales on credit and exchange losses are some of the challenges affecting the development of her business. 

Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for promoting the independence of women entrepreneurs who cannot access the banking system, especially at this critical moment when war has broken out in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy one bale of clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy disk parts to produce keys.

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es:
Ana de 37 años, solo estudio cuarto grado, es acompañada, su esposo trabaja fuertemente en la agricultura en la siembra de hortalizas. Tienen 5 hijos, la primera estudia tercer año de bachillerato, el segundo estudia noveno grado, el tercero y la cuarta no estudian, y la última niña estudia quinto grado, en la escuela de la comunidad. Por el momento, todos viven con ella en su hogar.

Ana se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de hortalizas, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a cultivar, desde joven ayudaba a sus padres en el trabajo del campo, cuando se acompañó no le gustaba que solo su esposo trabajara solo; si no que ella le ayudaba en lo que estaba a su alcance, ahora los dos trabajan fuertemente en el área agrícola, siempre ha sido vendedora de verduras, ya que en la zona donde vive es la actividad más fuerte que hay. El terreno donde trabaja, es ahí mismo donde tienen su casa. Generalmente trabaja de 6 a 11 am. Las horas más frescas del día.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizante, foliares y pago de mano de obra, para que le ayuden a cambiar los tutores de la guisquilera que tiene. De alguna manera, obtendrá mayor producción que le generaran más ganancias para invertir más en la parcela. Suplirá la necesidad de comprar tolo lo necesario para echar andar el proyecto.

Ella manifiesta, seguir apoyándose de la fundación, que le sirva de pilar para hacer más rentable la actividad a la que se dedica. Con las ganancias, que obtenga dice que quiere mejorar la vivienda hacerla al menos de adobe para que sus hijos no vivan en inseguridad.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, only completed fourth grade.  She has a spouse who works hard in agriculture growing vegetables.  They have five children.  The oldest is in third year of high-school, the next one is in 9th grade, the third and fourth don’t go to school and the youngest attends 5th grade in the community school.  They all live at home with her.

Ana has been growing and selling vegetables for 7 years.  When she was young she helped her parents with the field chores and when she married she didn’t like her husband working alone so she would help him with everything she could.  Now, they both work hard in agriculture.  She’s always sold vegetables because in the zone they live this is the strongest activity.  The land they work is right there where they have their house.  She usually works from 6-11 in the morning which is the coolest part of the day.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy fertilizer, leaf fertilizer and to pay labor costs to replace the guide-wires for the chayote vines she has to climb on.  She will thus obtain larger crop yields that will generate higher profits to invest more in the land.  It will meet the need she has to buy everything necessary to launch the project.

She states that she will continue relying on support from the Fundación that will act as a pillar to make her activity more profitable.  She will use profits earned to make home improvements.  She’d like to at least make it out of adobe so her children won’t live in unsafe conditions any longer.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Hilda Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Vicenta de 37  años de edad,  es casada, no tiene  hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia en una comunidad de Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras. 
Doña Hilda Vicenta se dedica desde hace 08 años  al negocio de la venta de verduras, frutas y lácteos, en un mercado de Nacaome sus ventas son  de lunes a domingo sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y buenos precios. 
Doña Hilda Vicenta está solicitando el préstamo para la compra papas, tomates, plátanos, bananos, manzanas, uvas, aguacates, queso, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
Doña Hilda Vicenta es un cliente que solicita su segundo  préstamo, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Hilda Vicenta, 37, is married and has no dependent children.  She lives in her own house in a community in Nacome, a valley in south Honduras.

Hilda Vicenta has worked selling vegetables, fruit and dairy products for 8 years in a market in Nacome.  She sells from Monday to Sunday and her customers prefer her because of her good service and prices.

Hilda Vicenta is asking for the loan to buy potatoes, tomatoes, bananas, plantain, apples, grapes, avocados, cheese, etc.  With the loan’s support she hopes to increase her income and thus her quality of life.

Hilda Vicenta’s asking for her second loan and her dream is to improve her business and her quality of life.  She’s very happy to continue working with Prisma.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2013.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and cheese.

loans.name: Mame Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Awa, âgée de 52 ans, est une cliente de l’IMCEC depuis plus de 2 ans mais n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit. Elle élève des bœufs et a acquis une expérience de deux ans dans ce domaine. Elle a commence avec ses propres moyens depuis 2 ans, mais étant peulh, elle a toujours aimé et  approchée les bêtes  depuis le bas-âge donc c’est par passion qu’elle s’est lancée dans cette activité. Elle cherche des vaches qui pourront s’accoupler avec des bœufs et elle pourra emboucher les petits et les revendre au bout de quelques mois. Mame Awa bénéficiera aussi pendant cette période, de lait de vache pour consommer ou pour revendre.
C’est à partir des recettes, qu’elle gère les charges de la famille et peut améliorer leurs conditions alimentaires. 
Elle veut devenir une grande éleveuse de vache.
texts.en:
Mame Awa, who is 52 years old, has been an IMCEC customer for more than two years, but this is her first loan. 

She raises cattle and has two years’ experience in this area and began her business two years ago with her own money. As a Fula she has always liked and been close to these animals from an early age, so her passion led her to start this business. 

Mame Awa is looking for cows to couple with bulls so that she can fatten the young to resell after a few months. During this period, Mame Awa will also be able to obtain milk from the cows, to drink herself or resell.

The money she makes will help her to meet her family expenses and improve their diet. 

She would like to become a major cattle farmer.

loans.use: to buy cattle to farm and resell.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, who is 33 years old, is a rural villager from the Moung Russey district.  She earns a living through farming rice as the only main source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

Touch’s group consists of two members, both female. Mao is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and completely paid back the loans, which helped her to better support her family. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Mao will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use some of it to spend for labor and land plowing. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and sell her rice for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Erika Lucia

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete,en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora,entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Erika no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que desea.
Por iniciativa propia, Erika trabaja como camarera en un restaurante de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Erika se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poner piso de concreto a su hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Erika’s a single, 20-year-old woman living with her parents and siblings in the city of Cañete in Imperial District.  She’s very hardworking and enthusiastic with a strong self-improvement drive.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and the need to start working, Erika was unable to study Law like she’d liked to.

On her own initiative, Erica works as a waitress in a restaurant in her city.  She works for about 10 hours every day and believes she does well thanks to her dedication and effort.

Erika’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will make some home improvements.  She wants to install cement flooring in her home.  She will continue working and striving to reach her great dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase frozen foods like tempura, fish balls, squid rolls, etc., to sell in her food-vending business.

Avelina has been in this business for four years.  She also earns income from a general store.

Avelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding  her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase frozen foods like tempura, fish balls, squid rolls, etc., to sell

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José de 29 años, no tiene hijos hasta el momento, está soltero, con él solo viven sus padres y sus hermanos.

Se dedica a la siembra se granos básicos como frijol y maíz. En algunas ocasiones había sembrado  hortalizas, pero por falta de recursos económicos dejo de hacerlo. Él tiene aproximadamente 25 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, desde pequeño iba con su padre al campo, algunas veces a dejarle los alimentos y se quedaba con él hasta que era hora de salir de trabajar; fue así como le gusto y empezó a trabajar poco a poco con parcelas pequeñas. Él solo depende de la agricultura,  y la parcela donde trabaja le queda a unos 15 minutos de su casa para llegar se conduce a pie.

   El financiamiento lo necesita, porque ha llegado una institución que les brindará asesoría técnica y parte de los materiales necesarios para siembra de hortalizas e instalación de un pequeño  sistema de riego, pero necesitan una contrapartida para cubrir todos los gastos que requiere, esta parte que él pondrá será depositada a la cuenta de esta institución. Obtendrá mayor producción y con ello ayudara a su familia a cubrir las necesidades básicas, será satisfecha la necesidad de no andar buscando quien le preste el dinero.

Desea, seguir trabajando con la Fundación que le sigan apoyando con los financiamientos, mejorar poco a poco el sistema de riego que le darán, ampliar el área donde trabaja y obtener más ingresos, para que su familia tenga lo necesario en cuanto a alimentación, vivienda, calzado se refiere.
texts.en:
José, who is 29 years old, has no children for now. He is single, and only his parents and siblings live with him.

He works growing basic grains like beans and corn. At times he has grown vegetables, but he stopped due to lacking financial resources. He has been farming for approximately 25 years. As a child he went to the fields with his father, sometimes to bring him food, and stayed with him until it was time to leave work. That is how he learned to enjoy it and started working little by little on small plots of land. He lives solely off farming, and the land where he works is about fifteen minutes away from his home, so he gets there on foot.

He needs this financing because there is an agency that is offering technical consulting and part of the necessary supplies to grow vegetables and to install a small irrigation system, but they charge a fee in order to cover all the required expenses. His contribution will be deposited into the agency's account. This way his work will yield higher productivity and he will be able to help his family cover their basic needs. His need to look for someone to lend him the money will be met. 

He wants to keep working with Fundación and for them to continue their lending support. Little by little, he will improve the irrigation system he will be provided, expand his working area, and obtain more income so that his family has what they need regarding food, housing, and shoes.

loans.use: to pay an agency's fees and install an irrigation system.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is a rural villager from the Moung Russey district of Cambodia.  She is 36 years old and married, with three children, who are still in school. 

She and her husband have been growing pineapples for 13 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 59,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Ra is in her first microloan with VisionFund. Now that she is asking for a loan, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business and make more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Manzese B Group

texts.en:
Atuganile, who is a single woman with four school-age children, has been running a food business, selling snacks and soft drinks, like juice, soda, and water. She is in her early 40s and she has been in this business for two years now. She works from 6am to 6pm per working day and she is able to make a good profit per month.

This is Atuganile's fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy additional soft drinks for her business. 

With the previous loans, all of which were successfully paid back, she bought more inventories of soft drinks and snacks. With the business profit she received, she managed to cover school fees and she paid household expenses. Atuganile dreams to buy a plot of land and to build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Manzese B Group, which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Estrella Del Apante Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Estrella del apante, está conformado por nueve integrantes, siete mujeres, y dos hombres. Madres y padres responsables de familia con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Telica, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Xiomara y  tiene por actividad económica la venta de  ropa usada como pantalones, short, faldas, camisetas, piyamas, ropa de cama. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Estrella del Apante agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank Estrella del Apante, is made up of nine members:  seven women and two men, mothers and fathers who have a total of 15 children under their care.  They hail from Telica, a place that is situated in the western part of the country.  

They are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a personal desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to study a profession and felt obligated to work from a young age in order to help with household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Xiomara is the coordinator.  Her business is the sale of used clothing such as pants, shorts, skirts, t-shirts, pajamas and bed linens.  She works around 10 hours a day from her home.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business, so that in a not-so-distant future, she can get better earnings.

The Estrella del Apante community bank is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide them so that they can make a respectable living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with used clothing such as shorts, skirts, t-shirts, pajamas and bed linens.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: La señora Lucila se dedica a su negocio de una pulperia ubicada en el barrio bello amanecer, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales uno depende de ella , esta en edad escolar por el cual se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante trabaja fuertemente en su negocio para verlo cada dia mas grande , ella tambien en su negocio vende tortilla y frijoles cocidos, vende de lunes a domingo desde las seis de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche, la señora Lucila solicita financiamiento para agrandar su negocio y tener varidad de mercaderia  para obtener sus ganancias que le permiten salir adelante dia a dia.
texts.en:
Lucila works in her grocery store located in the Bello Amanecer neighborhood.  She’s mother of four children one of which is school age and still depends on her.   She works hard to support him and to see her business grow more every day.  She also sells tortillas and cooked beans in her store.  She’s open from Monday to Sunday from six in the morning until eight at night.  

Lucila’s asking for this loan to enlarge the store and to have a variety of merchandise to earn profits that will make it possible for her to get ahead day to day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.
